text: They overcooked 2 steaks in a row, then the manager said "I'm not going to argue with you" after she was arguing with us for 3-4 minutes. Do I need to even say anymore about our experience there. You couldn't drag us back in their doors.

I was visiting Las Vegas and brought a coupon via Travelzoo as the restaurant looked good. We went there on a Sunday night. I did make a reservation as requested on the coupon, and the restaurant did take make it. When we arrived the restaurant was only half full and a sign said to seat yourself. We shared one appetizer, the crab cake duo. That was pretty good with what tasted like real crabmeat, and not too much ratio to bread. For dinner we had the grilled rosemary salmon and the 14 oz angus rib eye steak. The steak was absolutely fabulous, however the salmon was so-so and the zucchini was barely cooked. That may have been because we think the kitchen messed up the salmon order, the waiter came to offer us extra wine. We ordered the fried oreo with vanilla ice cream for dessert that the waiter recommended. I've seen fried oreo but that was the first time I tried it. It was absolutely fabulous and I would recommend it. We didn't try the martinis, but the restaurant food was not bad. I am giving it a 4 for the odd seating, high tables with low tables on the other side. It is a cross between restaurant and night club little bit confusing over what it wants to be.
The food is amazing!! I work next door and the food is always good. Consistent. Kristy and AJ are the best. AJ makes the best margarita flatbread. Highly recommend.

A friend recently sent me a burger top 10 list from the Review Journal which included many local spots, the likes of which I've been trying to track down since starting this blog. Being the dummy that I am, I didn't pay attention to the date the article was posted until I tried to visit one of the locations only to find their kitchen is no longer open. Still determined to eat a burger that night, I tried a second location which had almost the same name but a totally different burger. That place is now called The Martini, and the burger was still really good.

The Martini is kind of a 'hip' local neighborhood spot in Summerlin, great for yuppie housewives and overage guys that are too lazy to go all the way to the strip. Aside from the few groups of cougars and strange middle aged men drinking expensive bottles of champagne on a random Wednesday night it seemed like an ok place to grab a bite to eat.

The burger from my list was no longer available, but in its place was an assembly with Wagyu Kobe beef, blue cheese, prosciutto, mushrooms, caramelized onions on a pretzel bun with Cabernet Demi for dipping. Quite a complex situation for such a basic spot, so I was very intrigued by this. They also offer an 'All American Burger' with more of the standard toppings, but I wasn't interested in that.
My larger burger came out looking quite good, and tasted equally good at the first bite. The meat was cooked a little beyond the medium-rare I had ordered, but still had great flavor. I'm often weary of blue cheese on a burger as it can easily overpower the flavor, but this cheese was subtle enough and tasty. The onions were also not too strong which is a good thing, the mushrooms on the other hand had more flavor and were really good. I don't think the prosciutto was actually present on my burger, but I had enough going on already. The pretzel bun was very soft and really quite tasty as well. Overall it was an elaborate but very good burger.

The Demi sauce was very good as well, but extremely overpowering so I only dipped in moderation as I was here to analyze the burger. Instead I used the sauce for a lot of my fries which were just ok, not great. Unfortunately this is becoming a trend in the fry department, and they really detracted from the overall meal. I wish chefs would pay more attention to the fries!!

The price was just about right as well; $13 for the burger with fries was very acceptable given the quality of the meat and overall complexity of the meal. I wish the fries were a little better, but this wasn't a bad deal even for a place far away from the strip. In no way was this the perfect burger, but if you live on the west side and want something a little bit different, check this one out.

I noticed no one has written a review for "The Martini" (previously known as Martini's). However, since they are under new ownership I took it upon myself to devirginize them on Yelp.

First of all, it's been forever since my last review--I've been so busy (aka lazy LOL), but I honestly think the people who work here and run the place are terrific and I hope a favorable first review will inspire other people to try this place.

I often make my rounds at the smaller gaming bars/ restaurants near my house because:

1. I hate the traffic on the Strip
2. I prefer cozier places where I can actually have a conversation
3. The prices on the Strip are outrageous (yes a $20 martini is not just an urban legend)

My roommate and I had heard that one of our favorite bartenders Al who had formerly 'tended at the Sedona Restaurant moved here so we decided to give it a whirl. I had only been to the old Martini's once after pulling one of my all-nighters so I really didn't remember it well. Regardless, I was excited to try "The Martini" for the first time.

My first impression when entering the place is that it's elegantly laid out and immaculately clean. This goes without saying, but sometimes you go into a gaming restaurant/ bar and it feels dirty and ghetto and it goes downhill from there. This is not the case with The Martini--it's nice.

The staff here is GREAT and I've been here several times and have always had great service. The manager Nick is also great and he always thanks everyone for coming in. He seems to go out of his way to make sure everyone is comfortable regardless of age, race, or orientation--which I find highly respectable. I've also met several other industry people who work at restaurants / bars in the surrounding area, which is always a great sign that the place is good.

The Martini also has a extensive & diverse food menu that's way better than your typical bar food. In the 6 or 7 occasions I've been here since their reopening, I've tried several dishes and haven't been disappointed yet. I really enjoyed their cheese & salumi plate and they use a filet for their steak & egg breakfast, which i did find exceptionally good.

Of course they are known as "The Martini" so they have a wide selection of martinis & martini-esque drinks to choose from. I've tried the traditional and the Pom, which were both good and balanced. They also have a pretty good wine list to choose from, both by the glass and the bottle and several beers on tap.

The place is also a full gaming bar with several machines along the bar--I'm not a huge gambler so I can't really comment on the machines but I'm sure you'll find something to tickle your fancy if you're into gaming. 

Overall I really like The 'new' Martini and it's my new go-to place near my house. If you live in the area or are passing through, give it a try!
Great service and a very nice menu.  The sausage and cheese plate is excellent and has some really great cheese choices.
Health was our server and was very knowledgable about the menu. The food was awesome and so was the food. The pomitini was great!!!

I've been to 40+ countries and 29 states but this is my favorite bar! Mainly because of Amy, the best bartender I have met. It started when I celebrated my birthday there a couple of years ago, she was so sweet.

Food is great, drinks are great and the atmosphere is awesome. It makes me travel from Sweden just to go there...
Love Love love the bar tenders!!! The bathrooms need help though, smells like backed up sewer. Food is usually really good. But owners for sure need to take care of that bathroom situation.

Ate here with my family a few days ago and had a fantastic evening. Great food, excellent service and warm, comfy atmosphere. Love that this place is open 24 hours. Its the perfect spot to relax and grab a drink after work. Can't wait to come back and try their happy hour with my friends.
Shitty food for shit-faced drunks. Will never eat here again. We could not finish our food. Don't waste your time.

A great fusion between a casual bar and an upscale dining experience. It's obvious that the management here pays a lot of attention to detail. Every dish is always well plated with a careful and caring hand, even the delivery orders. I recommend this place to anyone who wants a casual and relaxing experience, but still wants food that makes them say "WOW". I don't live on that side of town, otherwise I would come more often.

Let me start by saying I am not a very picky eater and I have never not finished a meal no matter how bad it was.  That has changed.  My entree was the ribeye steak with mashed potatoes and steamed vegetables.  I ordered it medium plus like I do at all steak houses(I know, this is not a steak house).  It came out charred in some parts of the top but yet still pink on the inside.  It was the most dry and chewy steak I ever ate.  I actually had to spit out my fifth bite because it was so bad.  I didn't touch the rest of it.  I then tried some of my wife's chef special(chicken parmesan).  She had stopped eating because she said it tasted like a Marie Callendar's tv dinner.  I had to concur.  The only reason I did not give 1 star is because the appetizers were good(spicy ahi tuna chips, and artichoke dip), as well as the desserts(crem brule, and tiramisu).  Needless to say, we will never be back here again.  I don't think it will be open much longer, we went on a saturday night and there were only two other couples there when we got there and only another table when we left.  Pretty sad and disappointing.

We have been there a number of times.  I was attempting to try, at least once, every martini on the menu.  I must warn you that the martini menu has many drinks on it but only a few really are made well there.  I have gotten some really vile (as in too bitter to swallow) drinks.  So, stick with the really well known drinks, or you might be sorry.

The music they have is determined by the customer who chose songs on the jukebox in the corner.  You pay for and select songs to be queued up on the jukebox (this can be done from you smart phone).  However, if someone has more "pull" with the bartender than you do, does not like your music selection you will not be able to enjoy your selection since the volume will be reduced or shut off completely.  As the bartender explained to us regarding our selections: "There is this women with a lot of money who does not like country music".

We prefer to take our business where all the drinks are "safe" to be ordered and where if the music is truly customer selected the customer hears that selection and is not subject to the "censoring" of those who are considered too rich to disappoint.

I'm almost hesitant to review this place because it's such a gem and don't want the crowds.  Bottom line is it has really good food,  good drinks,  lots of TVs and a friendly staff.  Throw in a classy  atmosphere and you have a winner.

I've popped in here several times over the years and what can I say? The place is good - and local. The food is good, the drinks are good, and the happy hour specials are good. Despite the gaming, I've never found it to be really smokey, and it's quiet enough to go with coworkers or vendors after work and carry on a conversation. It keeps me coming back.

Just moved into the neighborhood and found this bar by chance. Went in a couple of times after work and it has a nice laid back atmosphere. Bruce the graveyard bartender is very nice. Carlos (I think that's his name) is also great he enjoys singing along to the country music they had playing. The food great and the specials are great.

I will keep this short and to the point. If you want to have food and drink in the Summerlin area. Stop in hear.. There good is amazing!!! It's not your regular bar food. It's a great dinner or lunch menu and great prices. The caprice salad is one of my favorites and I swear this place has the BEST risotto side in town. It's severed with either the Salmon or chicken dish. And great selection of martinis beer and wines. It's a must go!!!
$15 8oz filet on Sundays. Albert was our AMAZING bartender! The Pear-fection and Chocolate martinis were Delicious! Great friendly service! Machines hit!! I will be back!

I had a really nice meal at The Martini.  My husband and I had the Restaurant Week menu, and were very pleased.  The crab cake was homemade and the shrimp cocktail was small but very well done.  The salmon was excellent - very large portion, half of which will be lunch tomorrow.  My husband's filet was beautifully tender.  You could cut it with a butter knife.  The star of the meal was the fried Oreo sundae.  Fried Oreo cookies are sublime.  This is a really nice bar - definitely worth a visit.

First visit to check it out, Sept 2, 2016, 9:15pm, dining room, party of 3. First class service from Autumn. Excellent filet mignon and two burgers -- fair prices, great value. Loved the non-smoking ambience. Music volume curiously shifted from mild-to-loud-and-back twice in the evening. Sexy martinis. Looking forward to a second visit to try Happy Hour. Attire to consider: smart casual to professional casual.

First time coming here. I had a friend who was a cook here and was very good at what he does. He had went to school at culinary arts school of Nevada. They are very choosy with who they hire. That is why the food is very expensive. Its not prepared by just anybody. Anyway food is great. Drinks are so so. For a place called Martinis, they should really learn how to make ALL of them!!

This is our NEW SPOT!! From the great selection of craft beers, to the great happy hour menu AND great bartenders, you will be pleased!! Try the Chicken Ceasar Wrap--- BEST in town!! And my hubby LOVED the chicken wings!!!!

We've been meaning to try this place for a while.  I loved the house wine and the Huge glasses they came in.  Andrew - who wasn't our bartender at the beginning kind of took over and we were pleased because he was super attentive and friendly and made us feel like regulars already.  we will go back and hope to get him again.  The chicken pesto flatbread was superb.

I really enjoy coming to the martini. Its a upscale local bar in the summerline area.  The owner Nick, you can tell takes pride in bar by being there talking with customers and also behind the bar ready to jump in when needed.. he is accommodating and is super friendly so this is thd perfect spot for me and my friends to begin the night or end the night.  

I particullary like the blueberry martini.. although every bartended makes it different so you have to stick with the right bartender. 

The food is exceptionally great for a local bar.  I honetly have not had one bad meal or tried anything I havent liked. 

If you haven't been here definatly try it out and tell Nick I said hi!

What a great Neighborhood bar !!!!!! Great food and great atmosphere with great bartenders. Albert and Bruce are the best !!!!!!!
I'm at this spot 2-3 times a week.

.  Just made the move to Summerlin, and have been looking for a new spot for gaming and cocktails.  The Martini is certainly a step up from the typical gaming bars.  Has beautiful decor and the bartenders can make a drink with more that two ingredients (something you will not find at an average gaming bar). The Pear-fection was delicious pear vodka and pear puree with rock candy syrup, and lemon twist, just the right amount of sweet and tart.  Pomtini made with pomegrante vodka and cranberry was delightful I could taste the anti-oxidants.  Food was excellent and a great value considering the quality.  I had the grilled salmon with rosemary, and my guy had the spaghetti with kobe meatballs, he grunted good food in between bites.  BTW I am not a huge player but I hit did win first time ever at keno $240!

The only time I have been here is for my good friends birthday.  So, I have only been here twice.  I went here the second time a month ago, they changed a bit.  No more smoking inside?!?!?!?!?!?   Shit!!!!!!!!!!!!  However, their Martinis are to die for.  They even let me change things up with the specialty drinks!

Food is good, but small.  Everybody working there is very friendly and I love it.  There is nothing better than alcohol and a smile!  Thanx Martini's!
Have you even tried their Ahi Sliders??? Their Thin Mint Martinis? There is nothing more delicious in this world!!!! Wonderful wine selection and the kindest staff in Vegas !

I was just here last night and it was wonderful....the decor was tasteful yet a little dark which suits me just fine.  I loved that it was quiet and had a very "private" atmosphere.  The drinks were reasonably priced as well.  I didn't eat anything during happy hour but plan to be back to try the sliders!

Bruce is an absolute perfect bartender for his exceptional care of his customers and innate ability to sense what they need, be it quiet service or a friendly conversation. His drinks are poured perfectly, and he's never once missed anything on an order. I've only checked in a few times, but I've been here a ton. If I'm not feeling PTs, I go to The Martini for the steak special, which you can't beat. I've only had one bad experience, and that was on a night I don't normally go because I've always previously worked. It was a Saturday night / Sunday morning and the bartender seemed swamped with seven customers, three of which we're busy gambling, and three which he seemed to know personally and was spending all of his time chatting with. He wasn't interested in small talk, staring blankly when I asked him how he was doing, and then screwed up my drink. Service was slow every time I needed another, and he basically had the chef run the food and forgot about me. The chef that night though, a white guy with a beanie, nailed the steak to perfection. He seemed a sulky bastard, but working with an asshole bartender can do that. I salute his chefery, however, and hope that he's working the next time I go there.

This is the best place to go and feel like family. I love their salmon!!!  My son orders a spicy chicken sandwich that is out of this world. Yummmmm
Needless to say we go there as often as we can.

I love this place:) My co workers and I are always here after work! All the food here is amazing and very decent prices! The bartenders are always friendly, fast and most accommodating. Especially Dante- we love him!! :) & of course everyone else. They have a nice happy hour late at night which is perfect since we always get off very late after 12pm. And the best thing is they are open 24hrs too. The drinks, the food and the atmosphere are all perfect, I really love it here.

We enjoyed our experience this evening. Here is what I would like to share. Service was lacking. The server was pleasant but wasn't attentive. Not sure if it was a staffing problem or not. The calamari was tough and chewy. Don't order this dish. You will be disappointed. On the other hand, the angel hair pasta shrimp scampi was divine as well as the salmon dish. The presentation for both of these dishes were superb as well as the taste. Would highly recommend both.

Decided to try it out with my husband for happy hour drinks on a Friday. The happy hour pricing/menu is decent and has average drink and food selections. 
The customer service from our bartender will not have us coming back.
  Firstly, We felt very unwelcomed and the bartenders mood was very incongruent with her affect and nonverbal communication. I love to tip and i am always polite to my bartenders but we left after one drink related to our poor experience.
 I'm not in the industry, but as a local professional that includes customer service in my practice I think customer satisfaction is the key to a thriving business (which might be why this place was empty on a Friday during HH for lack of it).
Luckily for us, there's so many other local places to enjoy ourselves at!!

Stopped in for late night happy hour steak special after a long flight from Honolulu. Ordered med rare, came out well done after waiting for at least an hour. There was less then a dozen peeps in the place! Sent it back and waited 15 min before getting up and walking out. I mean, a med rare steak takes 3-4 mins per side to cook! Bartender was more interested in hanging with his regular customers than checking on us.

Came here for restaurant week. This place has a bar and gaming side and then a restaurant side which is quieter. 
The restaurant side is very nice, quiet elegant for a bar. The service is really good. 
We started off with shrimp cocktail, it is not on the normal menu, but is for special occasions. Either I was super hot from the outside heat, or the shrimp cocktail ice cold but horseradishy sauce was soooo good. 
Side sald and caesar salad are well done, good fresh lettuce, light and crunchy croutons. Not the rock hard kind. Entrees were big. I got to taste the pork chop with mashed potatoes, really great bang for your buck. Had a wonderful grill char to it, and a very tasty sauce. 
The chicken scallopine was cooked nicely too. It had a cream sauce with artichoke, and mushrooms. The risotto was also a very nice touch. 
Dessert was amazing. We had fried oreo sundaes. The fried oreos brought me back to new orleans' cafe du monde's beignets. And then there was a warm oreo inside. It is a must try! 

I also saw a special for $15 filet mignon from mudnight to 8am, or all day sunday. I will definitely be back as the yelp reviews and photos look good.

This is another neighborhood spot that I've passed by so many times, but that stops now! We wanted to go to Via Brazil (which is SO GOOD!) for happy hour but because that doesn't open til 5 (we needed a drink at 4) we decided to try The Martini. And I am so glad we did. The bartender (I forget her name) was super hospitable. The place was empty but for 3 or 4 people sitting at the bar. 

The happy hour drink and food menu is really good. They have several flatbreads, all of which sounded delicious. We ended up ordering the sliders (BF says they were really good) and the chicken wings. Now, I'm an admitted chicken wing aficionado and I thought these were really good. I ordered them medium and they had the perfect amount of kick. 

The wine pours were HUGE, especially for Happy Hour pours. 

The best part of The Martini is the ambiance. LOVED it! Dark, leather chairs, bar and tables (there's also a separate dining area but that was closed off for happy hour), and great music. This will be my new early happy hour spot. Definitely recommend!

Had a blast with So.  (Yes that is her name). One if the best bartenders in town.  I will be back for sure, to see her.  Never have tried anything off the menu but rumor has it  the food  is top notce.  She might not be able to see over the bar because she is only 4 foot nothing but she makes up in personality and she can pour a mean drink.  So you are my new favorite local bartender.  You will be seeing a lot of me, from now on.  Cheers!
We went there yesterday for noon martinis and fried zucchini. perfection all the way around. The atmosphere was great, service was wonderful and drinks and food were THE BEST!! Highly recommended!!

Good atmosphere, food was ok, service was extremely slow, we sat for awhile to be greeted after finally ordering we waited over 20 min for server to return to order another drink I went to the bar and the bartender was just as slow but added to the slowness with a crappy attitude. If your not in a rush and have nowhere else to be its worth stopping by, but bring your pillow and blanket just Incase.

This is such a great spot for happy hour! We got a few drinks and some snacks and it's such a comfortable spot. It was super hot out so having somewhere to go at the height of the summer that's cool and dark in the late afternoon was so nice. The food is delicious and the servers were attentive and helpful. The happy hour specials were also well priced so I'm sure I will be back soon!!!

This place is a hidden gem in West Vegas, Very nice atmosphere and service, and the food is absolute best , a hi tuna sandwich was so good that I ordered it 3 times in a row in three visits but last time I cheated on a hi tuna and ordered the filet mignon and I am glad I did it was delicious, definitely this is one of the best bar/lounge food spots in Vegas. As for the bar it's fully stocked with a lot of drinks and it's a martini place I heard they make them really good but I never tried one, not my thing. Great fancy neighborhood spot free of trash filled with a lot of classines.
This place is very classy, the prices are good and the food is even better. Great place to have a drink and dinner.

Went in excited to find a late happy hour $15 filet mignon dinner, looked up reviews seemed like a go so we were on it!  Nice spot, literally 5 people in the bar so we ordered drinks, bartender was friendly, etc etc. ordered 3 filet dinners medium rare which, after about 30 mins was delivered by the chef and bartender. Cut into it, well done!!! Immediately notify bartender and he offers to redo.  After awhile 15 mins or so, we had to ask for him to check on the order.  He did but never came back with an update...a few more minutes, we've now been there an hour and still NO medium rare filets?  Clearly no one else was eating apart from one person who came in after us who already had his food.  The bartender was chatting up the other couple across the bar. It was as though he forgot about us,and who knows what the chef was doing apart from making us wait and so we paid for our drinks and left.  I've never walked out on a meal nor had such bad, indifferent service in a restaurant and I rarely write bad reviews.  Handled terribly.

I decided to quit going here.  The bartenders are great and the food is good but I couldn't win anything after they got the new machines.  I gave it at least a dozen chances and couldn't get anything.  What good is it to gamble if you don't ever win?
The best bartenders in town.  Food is so much better than normal bar food. Get the Eastwood burger you won't be disappointed....
Excellent cocktails, intimate dining room, and friendly staff. Not the best meal in town but the price is right and the portions are more than generous.

We found our late night chill spot. Definitely coming back!

It's a small but decent size bar. It wasn't too noisy. The ambiance is nice and pleasant and clean. Perfect for GNO or date night.  The prices were reasonable. Food was good.
Service is good. 

I like the location. I would bring more friends here.

This was my first time, and I ABSOLUTELY loved it!! Great service and the food was delicious!!! Great ambiance, and on the 2nd and 4th weekend they offer live music, which is amazing!!! I've passed this place so many times, but I'm happy I decided to stop in.

Nicer than your average PT's as far as ambiance is concerned, it's about the same as a Sierra Gold. Friendly, but aloof service, the waitress seemed to disappear for long periods of time . Good happy hour menu. I bought a regular martini here and it was pretty good and well executed, which I am glad for because it would kind of suck if their martini's were bad. This place had a pretty chill atmosphere.

Great old school ambiance.  Dark wood paneling and great leather chairs/couches around a sizable bar.  Massive menu of mixed drinks and wines and liquors.  Very unassuming  from exterior but warm and welcome inside.

Ordered from postmates. Best thing I have order off there yet and I have tried dozens of places. The tomato basil is to die for. The sauce with the fried zuzzhinni is great and the mac and cheese balls are great
My first time here and Donte (hopefully I spelled it correctly) ...he is amazing. I enjoyed the atmosphere ill will return under different circumstances. (I had to rush and leave).

Sights-  Atmospheric notch or two above a local pub and grub venue with it's low lighting and sections with comfy club chairs and fireplaces.  Large Bar and TV's throughout.

Sounds- Some great 90's tracks playing at just the right level.

Smells -  Eau de Sour Bar.  Not strong enough to make you gag, but persistent enough to cause constant olfactory distress.

Selections- Limited Happy Hour cocktail specials- $5 Skyy Vodka drinks, $4 well drinks, $3 drafts.  Small but varied selection of appetizers in the $5 to $7 range. 

Service- Efficient and pleasant.

We had: 
A Skyy Raspberry Cosmo & a Stella. Shrug! 

The Ferrari-Carano Marinated Chicken Flat-bread with Caramelized Onions, Jack Cheese and Mushrooms.  Truly delicious and savory!

Synopsis-  The stench was a super bummer.  The happy hour drinks, though cheap, were uninspiring; just drinks, not craft cocktails.  The decor was OK.  The flat-bread was terrific, but that alone is not enough to make me want to come back.

This is my absolute favorite bar in Summerlin. The bartenders/ servers are so cool and always remember my drink and food preferences. Isabell, Jamie, and So are always so friendly and make amazing drinks. The owner is frequently on site and takes pride in her bar. I love that it is a non-smoking bar during daytime hours and it never smells like smoke from the night before (they allow smoking at night). The menu is not your average bar food and there are lots of healthy options and the cooks have always been accommodating with my gluten sensitivity. They have a great happy hour from 3-7 I believe. 
If you enjoy gaming, then I would highly recommend this place because I feel they have the loosest machines locally and lots of free play awarded. 
Great job guys! Keep it up!

Just a side note* my husband and I had our very first date at the Martini for my 10 yr h.s. Reunion so this place will always be special to me.

Writing this review as a general overview of 3 total experiences here. 
Favorites are Grasshopper, Lemon Drop, Gimme S'more and Mocha Martini. 
Haven't been able to try their food menu though. 
The first time we went (day before Valentine's of 2015) was the time that won me and my boyfriend over, and we had just Yelped the place 'cause we wanted to leave a party earlier than expected. The bartender was nice, had a chill atmosphere and clean setting. 
Second time we went was for my birthday. Service was still awesome 'cause we were constantly checked up on at the lounge chairs by the main bar, and the server at the time was still attentive as we waited for my friends. The servers got me to try and I ended up liking The Blueberry which tasted like Fruity Pebbles. Still had the same good vibes as the first.
This last time wasn't as great of an experience though. Doesn't help to have high expectations because of previous experiences, plus it was our anniversary. Anyway... 
Server saw us seat ourselves in the lounge chairs we like going to, and gave us a few minutes to decide what we wanted after greeting us. Didn't take us long to get the drinks, but I honestly don't believe her when she told me that my Chocolate Strawberry was subtle on the strawberry flavor. I kept drinking it in small sips to find the flavor, and I even had the boyfriend try it. There was also a 20-30 minute stint when we didn't see her, but wanted to order more. Boyfriend was trying to make things better by just going directly to the bar (literally a few feet in front of us), but as soon as he got there, the bartender walked off. Wha...? 
The original server tried making things better when she saw my boyfriend at the bar counter, but at that point, I honestly just wanted to call it a night. Hoping this was just a fluke experience.
Great vibe. Food was outstanding and the drinks are heavy. If your looking for a nice place after work to hang with the buddies you cant go wrong.

The food here is so incredibly good. I shared the truffle mac and cheese balls with a friend and they were absolutely amazing. I also ordered a flatbread with chicken, pesto, and sundried tomatoes (which was equally amazing). The prices were really reasonable too.  

Drink selection seemed about average for a martini bar, but I was really impressed with the quality. The French Martini I ordered was excellently crafted and hit just the right strength (definitely not weak, but not too strong either). 

Service was good and all of the employees seemed really nice. The bar has a dark, cozy, casual kind of ambiance...which is nice, in its own way. This is definitely a place that I'd come back to again and again.
The caprese salad and flautas are amazing! Great service and excellent food. I'll definitely be going back.

I stopped into this place recently after picking up a friend late from the airport for a snack and a little gaming and was pleasantly surprised.  I really want to begin with the great service from when you first sit down and throughout your stay, as this is a pub that likes to get to know its patrons.  My buddy and I both have burgers with fries and were satisfied with it being a burger big enough to need to be cut in half yet still tasty with options like wheat bun, avocado, multiple kinds of cheeses and even sweet potato fries.  

If you're looking for upscale bar food in a 24/7 setting that is great with amazing service then I recommend you stop in for a snack and drink.

My first visit its alright not what I expected !!! have to say will try again !!! Service needs to be more helpful
Low hospitality.

I ended up here by accident and was throughly impressed. For it being a 24 hour spot they have an exceptional menu. I wasn't expecting the Kobie beef meatballs on the Italian spaghetti. Very well executed.

Came here on a Thursday night, a sign clearly says, "wait to be seated."..no one came and no one acknowledged we were there waiting at leaste 7 minutes... I went to a waitress about being seated (like the sign said); she said sure sit "in there"...looks like the remnants of a Thursday Night Happy Hour during a football game with crappy cold food. We just left...disappointed; i am sure no one was going to help us, since it looked understaffed and the staff seem to blend in with the customers...so who really knows.  Too bad, had the potential to be a local hang out spot for us, but was not welcoming AT ALL!  Surprised at all the good reviews...

Fantastic bar and restaurant. Great atmosphere and the kitchen is knocking it out of the park. I had the pleasure of meeting the sous chef the other day who also works for the N9NE Group so you know the caliber is top-notch.

As far as I know, they also have the only HCG diet-compatible menu in town, and they serve breakfast all day.
Staff is very attentive and friendly. I would definitely cone back. Music is loud but it's a good taste.

I am so glad I was dating a local when she introduced me to places that are "for locals". This was probably the chillest place we had been to at that point. Of course, there were video gambling machines as it is a staple in Las Vegas. It does not take away from the ambiance of the place. It had that upscale bar lounge look with the polished wood and classic bar in the middle of the room. TV's well situated. 

We had a charcuterie plate, we both had the chicken fettuccine alfredo with extra garlic bread. Spinach artichoke dip was like dipping chips into addiction because once you had it you will have wished you ordered an extra one as your meal. 

We played on the machines regularly so the drinks were basically "free". Yeah. But in seriousness the happy hours are awesome and you forget you're in a city that is designed to rob you at every turn.

We went for a quick drink and dinner.  Had a salad and my husband had the fish and chips.  Overall, the food was good, drinks were on special and the service was friendly.  Great atmosphere...lots of locals.
Delicious food, great drinks, nice ambience, the martini is a great night out! The service was beyond great! Fast and friendly!

Great place to have a beer and video poke, I always seem to hit a small to medium pot there. Bartenders Albert & Raj are always friendly and great.Everytime I go in Albert asked if I'm hungry tells me about what he's had from the kitchen and what is great, the food there is really good there.

Bartending staff is awesome!
The martini so are obviously great.
The only reason it didn't get 5 stars was the food... It was just ok.
Calamari was good but not my favorite.
I would recommend serving it with marinara versus the super sweet Thai chili sauce.
The chicken fetticinni Alfredo was macaroni noodles which was somewhat disappointing. 
The $15 filet special was ok. The steak was somewhat chewy and I wasn't crazy about the red wine sauce.
If you're looking for a good spot for happy hour, a few cocktails, and a nice quiet dark bar, this is your spot!

I have been a few times and each time I am so happy I went. The food is unreal! I have tried the filet mignon, the salmon, the chicken scallopini all which melted in your mouth! They have everything from espresso drinks to top notch wine. I love the fact that is a Vegas family run establishment as well. Everyone is really so nice and cares about making you happy. Gotta love that it is a 24hr place to!

I went in with a group of dear old friends to listen to some live music. 
Upon arriving and walking in the door there was already a very uninviting vibe to the place. The bartender was quite rude to one of my friends who did not deserve it. And it just continued from there... One of my friends was sitting on a high banquette bench and upon getting off the seat was caught  and tripped  on the loose trim around the step.
Rather than apologize the management tried to blame her for loosening the trim which is a fixture in the Establishmant!
Music was good but nit enough to draw any if us back there again.
Very unprofessional !!

The Martini was a neat bar with a lot of potential.  Its such a nice building and has great lounge chairs and sofas.  It was a little odd for such a nice establishment to have Touch tunes and sports on the TV.  It's the first classy joint meets sports bar that I've ever been to.  We will probably go back and have more martinis and give it another try.
Great atmosphere, live music and amazing food! Large drink variety... love this place!

Awesome little location tucked away on the corner of Charleston and Fort Apache. 

Interior is nice and loungie with a good number of seats at the bar and comfortable couches and tables. Didnt get a chance to take a look at the dining area but still impressed by what i saw.

The night we went the special of the day was a caramel apple-tini for five dollars. The cocktail was nicely balanced but lacked a noticeable caramel flavor. It was still smooth and well worth the price. 

Since it was my first time here and it wasnt happy hour and we just came from a meal the drinks were what we were there for and we werent disappointed.

Overall this is a nice little quiet classy spot away from the fast paced hustle of faster and more overly populated places in Vegas.

Absolutely beautiful bar, amazing staff and overall wonderful experience!! Our bartender Bruce was so friendly and patient with us since it was our first time and we had quite a few questions. We had fun playing golden tee and just had a great time! We definitely will be back! If you're looking for a beautiful clean bar with amazing staff and drinks this is the place for you!!
delicious food!good atmosphere and friendly staff.the big choices of dishes and yummy desserts!
Good drinks mediocre food and really crappy high prices. Staff is nice though.  I wish they would advertise more.

Very happy to have found this place.  So tired of the run down "dives" around town.  Very "cool" joint.  Quality bar.  Classy customers, nice/friendly bartenders, great martinis.  (Apple was delish!)  We only had some appys - flatbread, delish, flautas too.  It's a classier joint - you'll look out of place if you come in shorts or sweats!   Does have some TV's.  It is NON smoking!!!!  (Which I love!)  Will def be back!  *Update*  It's been awhile since we were back and bad on us.  We were there last night to see Michael Grimm sing.  (You can Youtube him.)  Excellent singer.  Great vibe.  Nice acoustic evening.  And we still love The Martini.  Sat in bar area with another couple in those nice cozy, club chairs.  Had some appys again - zucchini fries, calamari, edamame, and my husband got a chicken wrap.  Food is still great.  Cocktails this time, blueberry martini, The Vesper, (MY NEW FAV!) and a Sweet Q.  All awesome drink choices on the menu.  All delicious.  Atmosphere is great.  Classy place.  Cool joint.  Nice clientele/customers.  Great service.  We are bringing back more friends for a happy hour in the near future.  Keep up the good job!
I met the owner tonight and he couldn't give a ship  ... won't go back... terrible and self entitled... yuck

This place is absolutely beautiful. Nice relaxing environment, very clean, I mean very clean. Came here because Applebee's pissed me off. Kinda random spot but hey I'm glad I came. Jamie was our bartender and took really good care of us. Helped us with food, drinks, the whole nine. My buddy got the filet mignon, the other homie got angel hair shrimp pasta, and I got the infamous bar food calamari. I definitely recommend this place especially for industry people Getting out late night. Filet mignon is $15 after midnight and they got a great happy hour list.

in a city full of bars - i would probably go out on a limb and say this is the best one i have been to. Classy, clean cut crowd and above avg bar food. great place for a drink and for food. hard to find bars in this city that has a good crowd that is more interesting in eating drinking and socializing than playing video poker...great place. lucky to have it close to my home!!

My go to spot for after midnight happy hour, great prices and if john is bar tending then reggae music which is I like. 

Good is good and cheap, check it out you won't be disappointed

I come here a lot for work and love the atmosphere here. The music, lighting, decor is all super fun! The staff is always friendly and helpful and the food is amazing. Get the pesto Chicken and avocado sandwich!

Love Summerlin! The Martini had a chill atmosphere and the bartender made a terrific dirty martini.  I didn't order any food but the food I saw other customers eating looked great! I'll definitely pop back in next time I'm in town.

I am typically here at least once a week. I have literally never had anything from their menu that has not been fantastic. Service is always personal and friendly. I honestly stopped going to other bars and restaurants because they simply cannot live up to my expectations that I get here.

This place is awesome! Went here when I was visiting Vegas and had a ball. The food was outstanding, the service was amazing (Albert, Mailani and Raj took great care of our party) and the machines were generous! Had I known about this before, I would have skipped the strip and headed to Martini. Highly recommend!

This is a review of the food only.

Dropped by here today for Restaurant Week but also ordered off the happy hour menu.

Started with cocktail shrimp, which were decent size and pretty fresh. Then tomato soup... which I can't decide if I like it. There wasn't much flavor to it. The filet minion, which I asked for medium rare, but was more medium. A bit chewy but had a burnt taste to parts of it. Came with mashed potatoes and spinach. Overall the main course was alright.

From the happy hour menu, had the zuchinni fries, which had no flavor and were huge chunks. The server saw we didn't care for this and automatically removed this from the bill. Also had the truffle mac n cheese balls, which sounded awesome, but lacked flavor. There was no cheese flavor at all. No truffle flavor. Bland. And the "sloppy joe" sliders. How deceiving! It was a regular slider with cheese, and also lacked flavor, and had no sauce in it. 

Desserts were better. Fried oreos with ice cream... can't really go wrong with that. And NY cheesecake, not as dense as it usually is.. kinda fluffy which is nice.

Overall, food was all bland. BUT!! Our server, Heath was amazing. He was very nice, professional, and on top of everything. He deserves 5 stars. If I ever do go back, it would be because he is a good server.

My husband and I came in tonight and tried a handful of dishes. Excellent!
The food was just delicious, service was friendly and it had a great vibe. We will definitely be back.

Say you want to watch two concurrent sporting events at the same time. You will have a very difficult time doing that here, as they have over a dozen TVs BUT each random cluster of 4 or 5 TVs are tied to the same channel, so during most busy sporting event days there is little to no chance that you will be able to request a specific game be shown other than the highly-subscribed, big-market NFL or NBA game that's currently on. They have a max of three (3) different programs on at any given time, which might suffice for a hotel bar in rural Minnesota, but certainly not for Las Vegas.

College gameday? Forget about it. There are so few available screen zones that often times all 3 games they're showing are on commercial.

Maybe it's because we don't drop big coin into The Martini's video poker like most of their customers do, but our request to watch a specific college basketball game during the recent Broncos-Steelers playoff game was shut down (with a surprisingly unempathetic attitude) by one of the bartenders who also never remembers we're regulars. So we didn't stay for what would have been something like our 60th+ visit to The Martini. Time to find a new neighborhood bar? Or maybe we should always peek-in first to make sure only our favorite bartenders are working?

Pretty delish!  We used to visit this place a lot but we hadn't been in quite a while.  My boyfriend insists that we keep coming back for one thing:  deep fried fluffernutter sandwhich with chocolate dipping sauce.  It's amazing and worth the sugar coma we lapse into after eating it.

The new owners revamped the menu and we haven't been disappointed yet.  The staff is friendly and kind.

My review is based solely on their happy hour. Stopped in with a friend for a after work martini only to be disappointed. I am a regular dirty martini drinker and the dirty martini I had here was honestly one of the worst ones I've ever had. It tasted purely of olive juice with shriveled up olives served in the drink. My friend had a apple martini which tasted like pre mixed syrup. Truly disappointed because the the location is great with great ambience. We had big expectations for a great martini since it's called "The Martini". We will not be returning here for happy hour.
Excellent food! Great price! Ahi chips are awesome, salmon was perfect.

First of all it's just an all around good vibe place! We came to see a musician on a Saturday night. Good menu, good service. Dining room was a little odd with no view into the casual bar and live music but it was still nice. Casual menu fairly priced. The Chopped Salad was heavenly and Fish and Chips included battered shrimp and zucchini were very tasty. We'll definitely be back.

The Martini is a quality niche bar for me.  The drinks will not wow you, and none of the menu items put a craving in the bowels of your soul that needs satisfying...but there are several reasons why you should make your way in here from time to time.

Upon walking in to the Martini you immediately realize that this is not your average Vegas neighborhood bar...it looks and feels too nice for that.  It is certainly aesthetically pleasing with a classy, warm feel.  They a lot of nice TVs here that make it a great spot to watch the game.  They also have an early Happy Hour with food and drink specials.  One of my favorite things is that the kitchen is open late, so you can head in to The Martini after 10pm when most other places have closed their kitchens and still order up some decent  food.  In general I would shell out 3 Stars for the bar & restaurant...but when you include these niche specialties it's and easy round-up for me.

The food here is tasteless. Four in our party with steak (tough) and fried shrimp. Wife had scampi with pasta ( no flavor) . Good waiter and a quiet atmosphere. Very big place at 6 pm only 3 parties eating. We love to give local restaurants a try but will not be going back
I love this place.  Nick is an awesome bartender! The drinks are amazing (I love every Martini I try).  The service is quick and everyone is friendly.  5 star place:)

Before we move away from the area we wanted to try The Martini and then found a Travelzoo deal.   We were impressed by everything. The decor, the service, the food were all above.

Even with the deal our waiter, Dante, suggested that with just minutes left for Happy Hour we could order a drink at discount and then get the drink that was included with the meal deal.  A good suggestion.  We had their martini of the day with orange juice and it was refreshing.

For dinner I had the pork chop with mashed potatoes and veggies and she had the chicken cacciatore.  Both cooked to perfection.

The service was attentive without being pushy.

They just did all of the small things right.

Awesome food. Kinda creepy atmosphere and service. We went there mid day and were the only ones there so if you go at a different time this may be different. Food was delicious but be warned you may put on a few pounds after eating lol. Try the fluffer nutter;)

Me & my husband have been coming in after work on graves for a while now. The graveyard bartender Carlos is the best! So friendly & funny! Always grabs our log in cards and knows what we drink! We also love the chef at night Chris! He makes it a point to come out and make sure the food is good and it always is! They are a great team!! Love you guys!! Thank you for making our night every time we come in!!

Places like this is why I love Vegas. I come here all the time and the fact it's 24/7. 
From the fireplaces to the leather couches. A great place to hang out and unwind after work or catch up with friends. Plus they play amazing music from rock to hip hop then some old school classics and then top 40 their shuffle is on point. 
One of the perks is after midnight martinis are $5 and half off select food items!

Came here for drinks on my wife's birthday. The drink menu is excellent and the prices are pretty good. There was live music that night, a guy with a guitar, and it was really nice. It wasn't too loud and he was quite good. The atmosphere here is great. I would definitely go back for drinks again. It would be fun to try the food too.

Locals want a place like this! Out-of-towners beg to get off the strip to find a place where the locals go. Friendly bartenders and great food. Since the new owners (Starr family) took over, it's breathed new life into the neighborhood and into this place. 
I live in San Diego and frequent The Martini anytime I'm in Vegas. When you're here, you're family!

Great place for a pre or post dinner drink. Martinis obviously are awesome, and they do play live music on weekends. Service good and I have also heard food is as well but never tried myself. They have the best chocolate martini!

Amazing bar!  Stopped in on a Tuesday night and was greeted promptly by a nice male bartender that was dressed nicely.  He asked us if we had ever been before and gave us a menu.  Great service!  There were a few people scattered around the bar drinking, eating or gambling.  Nice atmosphere and very clean bar.  Didn't get a chance to check out their dining area but will be back. Thanks!

Dress: casual 
Vibe : cocktail bar 
They have a long bar area as you walk in dim lighting ...some TVs and some couch seatings .they also have another area of the place more to the left for table seating I took a peak but it was a bit narrow set up more so you can see the screens ....I sat at the bar ordered a COSMO which was amazing not too sweet ....To my surprise not pix because I was too hungry ....on a Halloween at 10pm I ordered a SHRIMP Linguine --can I just say yum light ,soft and packed with the right amount of flavor !

Not impressed. My husband and I were excited to try The Martini after reading the great reviews. However, our experience was not worthy of a return visit. We arrived during their happy hour and ordered 2 appetizers, a vodka martini and a gin and tonic, which had no alcohol and was very watered down. Our waiter maybe visited our table 2 times and it wasn't even busy. The first appetizer we ordered, the macroni cheese ball had no flavor and needed salt. The second appetizer we didn't even receive, the waiter completely forgot to put the order in. He even let our drinks go empty and never bothered to clear our table of finished plates. Bad service, Bad drinks. With so many other places to choose from in Vegas I would not waste my time.

I'm a big burger fan and the number one burger in Las Vegas is the Eastwood burger so spread the word this burger from the bun to the beef is outstanding I live in Summerlin and I finally found a place that I'm going to have a great burger and the bartender great guy and a great vodka martini probably the best I've ever had

This is second time I have been here. The first time the food was good but today I came in search of wifi and comfortable work area. The Martini did not disappoint! The wifi has been absolutely great! If your needing to work in Summerlin, this is your spot. Foods good, Wifi is great, theres no smoke and if work gets tough there is a drink just a waitress away.

I enjoyed the atmosphere. They make a great martini! I had an Appletini and a Gimme S'more. Both were delicious! From the happy hour menu, I ordered Zucchini Fries, which I will always order, wherever their available, and the BBQ Chicken Flatbread. The Zucchini fries were good, but I would have liked if an order came with a few more. The flatbread was good, and had lots of chicken on top. A good place to hang out and have a drink with friends.

I can't imagine that this place gets a lot of business. Tucked away in the back corner of an obscure strip mall, you have to know about this place and search for it. It's not exactly visible from the street, save for the signage by the road. But, once you find it you'll be pleasantly surprised by the lack of smoke, friendly service, and excellent happy hour deals.

We walked in and there weren't more than six other customers. Flautas ($6) come four per order. Well seasoned and tender shredded beef are wrapped in crispy, flakey fried shells and topped with tomatillo sauce and an avocado relish. The fried mac and cheese ($6) are three large meatball-sized spheres. The thick, course outer shell dominated the dish, with only a small amount of bland mac and cheese contained within. The dish was in desperate need of more roasted tomato sauce to give it more flavor. The lack of seasoning didn't stop there. The sliders ($7) would have benefitted from more sauce, too. At least the buns were buttery and light. 

While the food isn't outstanding, the happy hour deals of food ranging from $5 to $7 with $3 draft beer and $4 well drinks makes this a solid place to spend your late afternoon/early evening.
Love this place! Great gaming, food and the bartenders are awesome! Amy is the best, so helpful and friendly.
We always have a pretty good time here.  The Happy Hour menu is great.  The lounge area is nice. The pizza I had was yummy

This is what I call a perfect happy hour spot to go to after a long day when you want to be comfortable and low-key with decent food and decent happy hour prices. No crowds. No loud talking. Both the salami flat bread and the burger sliders were delicious.

Since this place reopened as THE Martini my husband and I have been twice. The first time was ehhh but we liked the atmosphere. The 2nd time we went was to give it another try and as well because everyplace else was too busy. That time around it was bleh. We had no desire to return....HOWEVER, after reading recent reviews on Yelp and again wanting to avoid long waits on a Friday night we gave it one more chance. Glad we did!  The food had flavor this time around, was fresh, and good portions. And, the funky smell was gone too. I had the tomato bisque with mini grilled cheese and it was excellent!  Then, finished with the fish and chips which tasted fresh and the batter was nice and crunchy without the fish being overcooked. My daughter loves the 5 cheese Mac n Cheese and also the trail mix salad. The only complaint this time around was the waitress' lack of desire or even willingness to try to change the TV (of 3 in the less than crowded room) to the college football game playing on ESPN. instead, we had to strain our necks to watch the game on the furthest away TV and be stuck with ESPN News on front of us instead. She even told us she didn't want to ask the bartender to change the channel...because of her lack of effort on that front her tip was only 10% vs 20% which she would've gotten otherwise.  UPDATE 2017: food is always on point. Service can be a bit slow but always friendly and when you do get your order taken it comes out quick. Glad this place seems to endure. Great local hang.
Anyone that leaves this place a bad review is crazy! The food, owners and especially the bartenders are the best in town! Don't believe the bs!
Spent some time here last night. Albert and Jamie are awesome! I will absolutely be back

Great place for a quick bite, and delish Martinis. 

(Walking distance too!)
Went last night.  Food good, no smoke, service a little slow.  Overall well worth it, especially with the $25 off coupon from ValPak.

We did not go for the martini's.  We went for dinner.  The bar was nice, the restaurant was nice and the menu selection was nice.   We did not order appetizers but we saw some being brought out to another table and they looked wonderful.  Unfortunately the food we ordered was not wonderful and the prices they charged were on the high side.  My friend order a margarita pizza and added chicken but when they brought it there had forgotten the chicken.  My husband ordered spaghetti and meatballs and it said it was just ok.  My friends husband and I ordered shrimp scampi with pasta and it also was just ok.  There are so many restaurants in Las Vegas that this is not a place on my list I would go back to.

I love coming  to this place but I don't know why this bartender Carlos still here, I come here a least  3 times a week and he always has an attitude towards us. I don't think I have to spend thousand as he said to be treated like a guest.  Nothing against the other bartenders such as Albert Bruce Maylani etc but he makes this place go down. I don't want to stop coming here but we tend to leave when he starts his shift.

I really like this bar, and it's not because it's super close to my house. They have really comfortable seating away from the bar and an overall really cool vibe. Sometimes on the weekends, they have decent live music. 

The staff are all super friendly, which is always a huge plus. I like walking into a place and feeling welcomed. Their drink prices are fair and they offer a wide varieties of martinis. They also have a decent happy hour that is worth stopping in for. 

They have a good menu that is definitely on par with lots of the usual bar foods, not a ton of vegan options... but they are accommodating when they can be. 

Overall, I would recommend stopping in for a quick drink and bite and hanging out with friends.

They'll "buy" you a drink for being part of the Service Industry. That means, you can work at a trashy Dairy Queen on The Strip and, HORRAYS, free beer :D

I like the crowd that comes here, but the women that come inside are "prissy" like, always talking about their fingernails, hairdos, and men with big words. 

Naggy, nag, McNag. Thats all the women from Summerlin talk about. Really annoying voices. Makes me wanna choke the shit out of em. Is this the tradeoff for meeting women that isn't a whore and comes from a richer part of town? 

Oh, and ignore the reviews with low marks on the food and service. I felt that the service is great and not overbearing. The people that wrote them are just bitchy. Probably one of those Food Channel motherfuckers, the ones that think that they are critics.

The Martini was definitely interesting! I will be generous with giving out these 4 stars though.. The ambiance of this place is amazing for starters! If you are looking for a nice quiet happy hour spot to meet some friends or co workers then this is for sure your place! So we arrived last week around 4:30 and I kid you not we weren't greeted or even acknowledged for almost 20 minutes! That I found a bit odd because not only was there nobody there at the host station to greet people as they walk in but because it was happy hour we assumed to just seat ourselves and somebody would come over.. This is what normally happens at most bars right? Well after 20 minutes we were finally greeted by a nice young lady who Apologized for the wait because she was the only one that was working.. The apple martini was a hit! I got the please of trying almost 4 different drinks and that would would have to be the best! Skip the cosmopolitan for sure it was gross and tasted like cheap vodka that was used! The food was exceptionally good off the happy hour start menu! The calamari and martini burgers are excellent! Do make sure you get your bill over $50 and check in so you can get the 15% off your bill :-)

One of my favorite bars. Great atmosphere and great appt especially $ during happy hour. This is also a smock free place! You are not gonna smell like an ash tray which is very rare to find such a bar in las vegas.
Great burger, good service. I sat at the bar so everything was prompt. Music a bit loud, but nice ambiance otherwise.

This spot has a nice atmosphere, especially because there's no smoking inside. The food has always been great, like mom's recipes comfort style food, but when it comes to the service, I am extremely disappointed. And that is the reason that I will leave The Martini alone to the "preferred customers" that the bartenders make it a point to serve.

I am a quiet guest who came in with a friend one night to see the last inning of a baseball game. We each played $20 in the machines at first, and we ordered a Cosmo. To be honest, it was just shitty, but I am going to assume that the bartender assumed that we wanted comped drinks for gambling and accept it. I actually traded mine in for a vodka on the rocks.

Within the next hour, there was no customer service. Within the next hour, we played a total of $300. In order to get a drink, someone had to have been waved down, which was not the case with some of the other patrons around us.

We weren't loud, obnoxious, nor drunk. We weren't behaving in any way that deserved being ignored.

It's a shame, but I just won't return to a place that picks favorites before they try to get to know a customer. It wasn't worth my time nor money.
Just ok- reminds me of a Bennigan's. Burgers were very overlooked - may as well go to the strip restaurants- kind of disappointed

Love this bar! I used to come here all the time when i lived in Summerlin, and now that im back on this side of town im happy to come here more often. I love how this is a gaming bar but not smoky like all the other ones. 
Food wise ive never had a bad meal here. The spicy salami flat bread and zucchini fries are always a great idea. If your looking for an awesome local bar this is your spot.

Stopped in for a drink with a few friends for Happy Hour. I really like this bar and not just because it has one of my favorite drinks in the name. 

Bartender is an attractive blonde woman, she was pretty attentive. Made sure to keep our drinks coming and refill our water. 

I ordered the calamari off the happy hour menu. It was ok. The breading was a little flaky, but calamari itself was good (not too chewy). The real winner was the Hot and Dirty martini. I thought it was a happy hour drink because the vodka used was Sky, but I was charged full price. If you are worried about happy hour pricing, make sure to ask in advance. My friend ordered the French Martini. I tried it and I wasn't that into it... but it's also not something I would normally order. It was a little strong for her. 

The bartender told us about the TV's and it looks like a nice place to watch football. This is pretty far from my house, but if I'm ever in the area I would definitely stop in for another martini or two.

For a while, I had The Martini bookmarked and labeled as, "To Try: Fish & Chips." As tempting as it was to order fish & chips when I visited, I didn't. Resisting the urge to indulge in a basket of deep fried delicacies, I chose the "healthier" route and ordered the Ahi Tuna Sandwich with a side of of house fries instead of the optional sweet potato fries and house salad. The sandwich wasn't bad. It was just an ordinary fish sandwich with greens and cheese. If it wasn't for the wasabi cream, it would've been dull.

The drinks are cheap and range from $8-$14, depending on what you order. My dining companion ordered a martini called "The Hummingbird" for its Elderflower Liqueur. The drink was presented to her in what appeared to be a laboratory beaker. It was a little bubbly, and it had a pleasant and light sweetness. 

Our server was excellent. Granted, my friend and I were the only two people in their dining room, but she came by often to see how we were doing. She even encouraged us to return the following day to checkout a few Chippendales dancers who were going to be serving drinks to ladies. Not really my cup of Ovaltine, but that was nice of her to inform us. 

The Martini is a fine neighborhood bar with fantastic service and decent food. I'll have to return when I feel like clogging my arteries with their fish & chips.

Eh, as 2 stars indicates, I've had better.
Came here looking for some food and drinks and just wasn't impressed.
The place is cute and attractive, nice comfy leather chairs as well as bar seats. But that's where it ended for me.
I ordered sliders but they brought me out a burger. I didn't care for the moscow mule too much either. Maybe I'm spoiled by other places, but this just wasn't good.
There was a Yelp check in offer so that made up for my meal and drinks.
Dont think I'll be back

I really liked this bar! 

A few coworkers and I met here after I suggested it from browsing good yelp reviews and everyone was very happy with the choice. 

We grabbed a couple chairs right next to the warm fireplace and our server Dante came over right away to greet us. 

Happy hour here is awesome! From 3-6pm you can find tons of cocktails and food specials including what we ordered which was $5 Apple and Strawberry Lemonade Martinis. The Apple one was deliciously tart and mildly sweet with a sugar rim and cherry. The lemonade one was a little on the sweet side for me but I guess thats to be expected. We also ordered the Mac and cheese balls and the zucchini fries. The Mac and cheese balls were ahhhhhmazing!! Four large bites of crunchy outside and cheesy inside! I could have eaten them all. The zucchini fries were large long battered fries served with garlic lemon aioli and homemade ranch. Another healthy portion of a not so healthy dish but a great bar food item!

Our server was great, the ambiance was perfect and our food and drinks were delicious! We will be back!

Went here for dinner the other night.  Food was great, especially the zucchini fries.  Service was a little slow but they only had a bartender and one server working.  Nice quiet and comfortable atmosphere with a separate dining area from the bar.  Will definitely be back!
Great local watering hole.  Diverse crowd and always someone interesting to talk to.  Good food st bar but I've never eaten more than an appetizer because let's face it...  I'm there for s martini !!
Atmosphere is casual but nice,  drinks are deficits and the food was phenomenal!  Fabulous for a date night or just a drink.

Maybe I need to come here again, but I wasn't really mowed over with awesomeness like I was expecting. 

Yes, it's a nice place, we sat at one of the 'lounge' areas with nice big comfortable chairs and our server was totally cool and nice.  By the way, a Yelp check in will get you a $5 shot of Patron for up to 4 people - that was nice! The inside seems kinda cramped or something , it's a strange layout with a huge bar and the lounge type seating areas kinda sprinkled around the bar so it has a cozy feel to it. Like I said it's probably just me. It was a nice place to grab a drink and b.s. and they've got some nice sized HD tv's around the bar area.

We didn't eat there so no comment on their food. We were offered a 'kitchen mistake totally free' by our server which was really cool but we weren't at all hungry so we turned her down. Next time I'll try and eat  something there and see how the food is.

Late night visit tonight, courtesy of my roommate who was celebrating her birthday and picked the place, and now I remember why I stopped going here when management changed a ways back.... 

Look, there were some good parts. The food was decent, fresh, tasted nice and came out fast - nothing to rave about necessarily but I would (theoretically) go there and eat again. It's tasty, especially for a late night bite. Drinks selections are varied and interesting, but wine tastes a bit stale (like it's been open in the bottle in the fridge for way too long).

The big problem is that the service honks. For me, there's a thousand options in this town for food and drink, and many of them have quality offerings, so what really brings me back is service. And service here stinks - never worse than tonight. Sat down and waited nearly 10 minutes to be acknowledged and offered a drink. Actually, I had to ask for a drink. Had to ask for food. The only reason I had menus is because they were still sitting on the bar from whoever had them before. Let me say - the place was not busy. There were two guys behind the bar - one in uniform, one not. And if the one not in uniform was the owner, we're all screwed, because he was so disinterested in customer service this review won't mean diddly squat.

The inattentiveness and empty glasses sitting there for ages in desperate anticipation of  a refill were nasty enough, but the kicker was when the bartender miraculously stopped by to ask how we were (well over an hour  into being there and so irritated and exhausted flagging him down for service we were leaving anyways) and my friend responded with a question, and he, in all seriousness, looked at her, his eyes kind of glazed over, and then he just walked away as she was in mid-sentence. It was pretty much the rudest, most outright unbelievably inhospitable thing I've seen in any bar or restaurant in a long time. I'm not a big fan of people dissing my friends. This dude just did. not. care.

I'm in the industry, and I'd shoot myself in the face before a guest even had  a chance to complain if I ever behaved like that.

We didn't let it ruin our night - the service was so ludicrous and the snub so insane that we actually laughed our asses off. I still tipped over 20%, because our industry is all about karma and I can't help myself, but I'll never go back Martini's because their service sucks truffled macaroni and cheese balls. 

And worse for them - I'll be telling everyone else to avoid it too.

When I first walked in I was impressed. The decor is stylish and upscale. Loved the atmosphere. 

The service was terrible. 
My boyfriend and I get off after midnight, so we got there at about 2:30am. We sat down and after a few minutes the bartender came up and I said hi and he looked surprised, like he just noticed we were there. Then he said "give me a few minutes." Which sounded kind of rude. When he came back he asked us if we were gambling and got our drink order and after he brought our drink told us that it was a $60 minimum play for my martini and $40 for my boyfriends jack on the rocks. I haven't been anywhere ever that the rule has been more than $20 per drink so that surprised me and I don't understand why I need to play 3 times what my drink is worth at this one place. And the fact that he waited to tell me that until after he brought the drinks when he already knew we were going to gamble irks me. We were hungry so we stayed and got some food. We got the meat and cheese plate. That was good. Then we got the truffled Mac and cheese balls. We weren't impressed with those. And we got the ahi tuna sliders and those were AMAZING! 
We asked if we could smoke inside and the bartender said yeah as he was walking away. We didn't see any ash trays anywhere, he never brought us one and we didn't see anyone else smoking so I'm assuming he just wasn't listening. He kept saying he was Soooo busy but there were 10 other people at the bar other than us. I work in the service industry and 10 people at the bar is not enough to be failing this hard. Everything we asked for got "ok it's gonna be a few minutes" in response. What pissed me off about this is that we were here for an hour and before AND after we got our food the cook was standing in the bar area talking to people (he had also told us how they were REALLY busy) and the bartender (who never bothered to introduce himself to us, otherwise I would be mentioning him by name) did the same with people who were either regulars or his personal friends. He never came over to see if our food was ok. He only made my boyfriend another drink when he flagged him down. Took forever to bring us the check and forever to come back for our payment. I asked for $7 back and he came back and said he had given me "exact change" and it wasn't because he didn't give me any coin, so I kinda took that as my %15 tip not being good enough for him. 

I might get take out here but I won't be coming here for drinks or to dine in again. The bartender sucked. It was not too busy for him to give us good service. He was just too busy talking to care about us and didn't even deserve the %15 I gave him.

This is my absolute favorite bar in Summerlin. Mailani, Albert, so, mandi, Carlos, and Bruce are all exceptional bartenders who give nothing but the best service. The food is absolutely delicious and the smoke free environment really creates an upscale atmosphere. I've been coming here for years and it is always consistent. Highly recommend this bar!!!

Bruce - doll. Professional. Fun. Kind. Informative. Five star.
Food- delish!
Puppies at the door- I want to puppysit them immedijiately! 
23 yearold dbag customers- Nicks bday? Maybe? You're a dbag. Your friends are dbags. You act like you're still in high school. Grow up, children. Zero stars. 
I hope this wasn't a common occurrence with the kids because we loved everything else.

Firstly, I have been here a good few times now and maintain that if you're just looking for a few drinks in a chilled environment that's not too busy or a non smoking bar where there are some seats to spare on game night, this is one of the best places. A great selection of beers, wines and cocktails and the servers are always friendly and accommodating. Unfortunately the last time we came here, we made the mistake of ordering food and this is why I have to give it 3 stars. We ordered a few of the appetisers as we prefer to go with small plates and try a bunch of different things. 
The flautas were nice but lacked flavour, fast food fries are better, the chicken wings were ok - nothing special, the Martini sliders were a little greasy although the blue cheese sauce was very good and the calamari is some of the worst I've ever eaten. It came so burnt and dry, it was difficult to chew and swallow, the bartender was very nice in reordering this for me and it was definitely cooked better the second time but still dry and chewy - the chefs clearly did the best they could with a lower than average product.
The food was so heavy and of pretty poor quality that both my partner and I had stomach aches and felt very uncomfortable with it all sitting on our stomachs hours later.
This is clearly a place that focuses on the drink revenue over food, either that or they don't try that hard with the appetisers.
As a bar with drinks - 5 stars, with food - go elsewhere.

BEST neighborhood bar in Las Vegas. The atmosphere, food, drinks, and service is phenomenal! 
My work had our Christmas party here and our experience was great! We were frequently visited for drink refills and food orders. 
As all their bartenders are amazing, Jamie is by far the best; super welcoming, attentive, and polite.
Been to martini a few times place is ok way to much wood on the walls and very dark the food is ok at best. The good thing is they are open 24 hrs. If you need a drink!
Thank you, Isabella for making a mean-ass michelada! Seriously one of the best I have ever had!

We came in around 4 for their happy hour and played video poker.  We tried the Ahi sliders and the Truffled mac & cheese balls.  Both of which were good, but not great.  They took a really long time to come out.  We had a couple of glasses of wine.  When the check arrived they had forgotten to price the food at the happy hour prices and we were charged for our wine despite playing the whole time we were there.  All in all, not bad, but not great.

GREAT food ,Good drinks,Open 24 hours which is great for the late night cravings the only thing is if your in a hurry be sure to place a Togo order because the service there isn't the best of the best but perfect if you are trying to kill time ! I understand people get busy but iv gone on slow days and the amount of time u wait for your food in quite a bit. Also the prices are a bit high so add a couple of drinks your bill might be quite a number $$$The first time I came here I fell in LOVE with the trail mix salad .. So much I think I was frequenting this place about 3 times a week for it for a while, it's amazing !

I've been here a handful of times over the years for a cocktail, and the place is definitely ahead of the curve.  Good atmosphere, decent clientele, helpful staff.  I finally came here tonight for the late night happy hour, which runs from 12am-4am.  My buddy and I had:

flautas - $6, recommended by our bartender but was a bit underwhelming
sloppy joes sliders - $6, the most tasty app we got, A+
mac & cheese balls - $5, a bit disappointing, could use some more flavor
buffalo wings - $5, good flavor, meaty wings, good stuff

Overall a pretty decent meal for the price.  They have $3 beers, too, but we were gambling so we didn't have to worry about that.  I just wish this place was a little bit closer to my house.  Then it'd likely be 5 stars.

glad this place reopened.  great space.  the only down side is its proximity to summerlin.  i had the grilled chicken sandwich with pesto.  the chicken was moist and the bread fresh, but the pesto lacked flavor.  i'm guessing they used spinach as a filler instead of pure basil.  still, the sandwich was pretty good and the fries were also good.  i've also had the crab cake which is ok.  service is good.
So so so so smokey.   Ugh.  I hate that.  But I'll go there if it's late late and I don't wanna go to PT's!  But I just hate years later it's still so smokey.  Needs better ventilation.
