I was here in January for our Yelp Book Club meeting and we decided to have our last meeting of this year at the Martini again.  I came an hour early and had dinner.  

The dining room is small in width but runs the length of the building.  There's a nice wooden wall with some fireplaces that block the dinging room from the bar section and makes a great spot for our book club meetings.

I started with the Caesar salad.  Good dressing with nice croutons.  There was a lot of salad.  It wasn't a starter salad but rather like a dinner salad without meat.

For my main course, I ordered the chicken scaloppine.  While the menu says it's a chicken breast with artichoke, mushrooms, and prosciutto there was no artichoke.  The breast was very lightly breaded and fried and served with seasonal vegetables and risotto.  The dish was very good.  The artichoke would have added some to it, but it stood the way it was very well.

For dessert, how could I resist the deep fried Oreos with ice cream?  Four battered and deep fried Oreos and a martini glass of ice cream.  It was very good, but the Oreos lose something in the deep frying.  The creamy inside got lost with the fried crust of the batter.  If someone should offer me this again, I wouldn't turn them down.

My server was named Princess.  She was very good.  Great personality and good service.  She kept my iced tea filled all during my meal.  

As I was tackling dessert, one of our club members arrived and we were soon discussion our book about living in a Mumbai slum.  I felt somewhat guilty.

This was a recommendation from Bobby, Misti CM's man.  Thanks for the great rec!  This place had a really nice atmosphere.  The drinks were reasonably priced and yummy.  I had a lemon drop martini, while my friend had a thin mintini.  The food was tasty.  The server was odd, but he was prompt and he tried.  If we are in the area again, we would return.

A local neighborhood bar/restaurant/video poker establishment. I arrived early in the morning after going to the gym. To my surprise, there were still several patrons in the restaurant. Overall, the interior was clean, a lot of wood, and a large bar with inset video poker machines.

The bartender was friendly and attentive, not sure how much the time of day had to do with that. He briefly explained the regular and happy hour menu. I ordered a chopped apple salad and a pizza margherita. I really enjoyed the salad, a mix of sweet, salty, and a bit of tart. It could have done with a bit less dressing though. The pizza was a big dissappointment, bad crust and cheese, very little basil.

The two biggest positives of this restaurant are its hours of operation and its location! Average to above average food, a late night happy hour, decent service the hours I normally frequent, I am definitely a fan!

The martini is a swank "gentleman's" type of bar.  Lots of dark wood, leather, martinis and so on.  There are endless seating options with cozy tables by the fireplace, a huge bar with stools for gamers and non-gamers, and a separate dining area for a more intimate dining experience.  

If you want some real, tasty food in the late night hours, this is a winning spot.  I've sampled such items as the fish and chips, crab cakes, and chicken with risotto and been pleased with them all.  The menu is several notches above your average bar menu with treasures like shrimp scampi, mushroom flatbread, tomato bisque and salmon.  The chicken was cooked and seasoned perfectly and came with a delightful risotto and pleasantly crunchy vegetables such as zucchini and yellow squash.  The fish and chips really consists of 2 pieces of fish, 2 fried zucchini spears, 3 fried shrimp and a large portion of fries!  All of the items were cooked nicely in a flaky and crispy batter.  

The isn't a separate late night menu with limited options...you get the whole menu to choose from. Nice!

Prices are fair and the pour seems more than adequate! 

On my three visits, I've received very personal and welcoming service with a greeting from the owner each time.  It is a classy neighborhood spot where you would feel welcome and leave satiated.

Showed up to The Martini one evening because it was late and I was starving.  Was originally at Tivoli Village when a local suggested that we come here for a quick bite. She also mentioned that this was also a local hang out for other bartenders and locals around town. You really can't go wrong with a place for drinks when other bartenders go here, right?

Upon entering, my first thought was that this place is like the other pubs but more sleek and definitely more sexy.  I also noticed a few people from Tivoli Village that migrated here after they closed.  It's like the party out here in Summerlin never ends.

As for me and my friend for the evening, we shared a plate of calamari and I had their Ahi Tuna Sliders.  Both were excellent and we ended the evening with a few drinks.

Usually pubs are places to hang with the homeboys. The Martini flipped that idea and is more of a place with an intimate setting for a quick nibble and a couple of drinks.

Amazing locals spot, family owned & operated. Perfect food, a little high price wise, good drinks and service is friendly. Bartender makes a delicious dirty martini. Lovely, no smoking atmosphere. )))
This is a real nice place.  The Kobe burger  was very good.  I hope the Martini can stay in business, the night we dined the place was dead.  Good luck.

I come here at least once a week! The food is not typical bar food it's pretty fresh. Bartenders are super cool and make great drinks! I like how they have a jukebox with satellite so you can play any kind of music you want!

This place is def wayyy better under the new ownership especially the food. The menu has sooo much good items. I def recommend the kobe burger. Its on a pretzel roll and has a bunch of stuff on it. Also there are some hot rich chicks that go there at night. Just saying.

Wether this place has five stars or not, I recieved five star service from Dante at the Martini. We ordered a bbq Chicken Flatbread and 2 filet mignon meals medium rare. Oh my the steaks were so juicy and cooked to our exact expectations. Along with our delicious happy hour entrees we enjoyed several Martinis and a ginger Moscow Meal. Overall the night cap choice was perfect. The service was excellent.

Happy Hour is awesome.  It's a little early, but when you're running errands and ready for a drink but it's not quite "5 o'clock", pop in!  They repeat it again at midnight for night-owls.

FOOD - we had the happy hour flautas (4 stars), calamari (2 stars), martini sliders (5 stars), sloppy sliders (4 stars), chicken/onion/mushroon flatbread (3 stars), wings (3 stars for hot, 4 stars for the thai peanut) and the mac & cheese balls (5 stars...LOVE mac & cheese!).  Portions were at least 3 of each...but more wings & flautas and the flatbread was big/meal-size.   I thought the prices were great.

DRINKS - there's no scam on limiting the draft beer that's on happy hour to PBR or Bud Light like you see at some places....they were all on happy hour!!  The martinis are filled to the brim full-size martini glasses and not watered down.  

SERVICE - attentive enough/no complaints.  plates were cleared in a timely manner, drinks were filled promptly, food came out sufficiently fast. 3.5 stars

ATMOSPHERE - I liked it.  The bar area is a large bar that circles the entire bar area around the bartender w/ some in-bar gaming, but not every seat so it's not a total gambling joint.  There are 3 fireplaces w/ club chairs in front of the fireplaces...very cozy for a party of 2-5.   There's a nook at the front corner of the bar that would seat a bigger group.  There are flat screens thoughout the bar so the sports fan is entertained.  And there's music from a video jukebox so  music playing in the background even if people aren't pumping in $.  It really has something for everyone.

We peeked at the dining area when we left around 6:45 p.m.--it was packed so it might be a good idea to make reservations if you plan on going on a fri or sat night. 

This was our first visit and I forgot to look at the regular menu, but we'll definitely be back for the happy hour.

The Vespar!! This place is down the street & I decided to check it out. It was AMAZING! The food was good & the drinks were even better! The bar staff was super friendly & accommodating. I will definitely be returning to this place again & again!

Best go to spot for happy hour or anytime. Great food best bartenders overall awesome service. I always get the martini sliders and the tuscan flatbread its the bedt pizza ever! Bruce is amazing. Love this place

Great neighborhood bar with very decent food, comfortable ambience and very good service. 

This is fin(er) bar dining - good menu choices - along with a good cocktail (and beer and wine) menu to boot. 

Albert and So (both behind the bar) deliver.  

Go.
Currently my favorite bar in Vegas. Great bartenders, great food, non-smoking!, and the payout table on the video poker machines are pretty darn good (better than any other bar I've been to).

I have removed my 5 star rating from The Martini. After several visits, we have learned that it isn't the "friendly" neighborhood bar we thought it was. While their drinks are VERY good, the treatment of customers is not so good.  If you tip the bar staff with each drink, you get exceptional service, but if you withhold the tip until you pay your tab in full, they tend to treat you like an unwanted visitor.  Even going so far as to turn the music off when your selections come up.  We have been told they don't like Southerners or Texans. We did move here from the Boston area, but are FROM Texas/Georgia. Our accents and music preferences gave it away.  So if you are a Southerner, beware.  While we now live in NV, they make us feel unwanted to the extreme that we will never return to this establishment.  Our money will be spent elsewhere.

Great happy hour!  We head to the Martini for a paint class about once a month.  We make sure we get there early, before Happy Hour ends!  They have a $5 Martini of the day.  This time it was the "Orange TicTac."  It was quite tasty.  The menu also has great deals on their appetizers and flatbreads.  My favorite are the zucchini fries.  Thick cut, quartered zucchini, lightly breaded and served with ranch and aioli.  Fabulous!
Finally..... A bar with NO smoking! Love it!! This place has nice atmosphere, very good food and service. I will definitely be going back.

I have a networking lunch there twice a month.  This week I had the chicken Cesar wrap.  Very good.  Not a lot of chicken but the flavor was good and the sweet potato fries were as good as anybodys.  Service is always good.

Been going here for years... it closed 2 years ago but Nick swooped in and brought it back to life. The food is once again fantastic! The drinks are always on point. I make it a point to go every time im back home in Vegas.
The Martini is my favorite local bar! Great environment, great food, Great staff. Feels like family. The trail mix salad and salmon are my absolute favorite.

Me and my friends came after disk golf for happy hour. We live in the other side of town so wanted to try something on this side. Decided to hit this spot. We ordered off happy hour menu and decided to share everything. Hot Wings, margarita pizza, Mac and cheese balls, and flautas. Everything was so good. Great prices. And food is absolutely awesome. Would definitely come here again and recommend. My friend had the full sail ipa. Smoothest ipa he's had he says. So new hit spot for sure. Must try!

Stopped in for a late night snack & as always NEVER DISAPPOINTED!
Love this Place!

I was with a group for a business lunch meeting on Saturday 02/08/14. We were placed in the dining area which is partitioned from the bar area. We made arrangements with Sandy the Manager and we emphasized we the need for privacy and some degree of quiet as we would have a presentation and discussion for about 2 hours. It went great and the service was outstanding. We had 8 - 9 attendees and almost every ordered a burger. I had the medium Kobe burger, with sweet potato fries and a calamari appetizer. I enjoyed it and recommend this location. Our meeting went great and the food came out promptly and as everyone ordered. The waitress was very courteous and impressed us all by not writing down any of our orders. After the meeting a few of us stayed to talk further. I noticed the Manager Sandy came in to help the waitress bus and clean the table. It is small things like that that really impress. We will definitely be back. Also the prices are so reasonable. For 8 - 9 people $125.00 total bill. Get out of here! (we did not have alcohol though) The ambiance is very nice. Great place to take a friend or significant other..

Great place! Great food and drinks. The bartenders and kitchen staff are all fantastic. Service is great as well. Zero complaints here. 

People on Yelp complaining about slow service or "they ignore you if you're not a local" make zero sense as we found neither to be the case....not even once in recent multiple visits. And we're about as non-local as it gets. We totally recommend The Martini.

Albert!
The Absolute BEST Margarita I ever had!
I did not even convey how I liked it but he got it perfect.
We each had a burger at the bar. Fantastic.
Wish there were places like this back at home.
Even if we never stay in Summerlin again- we will def go back to The Martini. A real pleasure.
Mailani killed it for me!!! The martinis were top notch! Strip quality off the strip! Loved it. Definitely top tier service. Coming back again!
So happy this place is less then 1.5 miles from me!!!! One of the BEST spots in town, with incredible food and super friendly and knowledgable staff!!!! Great job guys!!!!!!!!!

One of the nicer bars in Summerlin.  The bartenders are really nice and attentive. Its clean and they have a dining area so I assume you could bring kids to eat as well. The menu is pretty legit and they have a good happy hour. On Sundays they have a complete 8oz Filet mignon dinner for only $15. That's a great deal and its delicious!
My boyfriend and I went there last week and the bar service was terrible. It is clear that if you are not a regular that you will not get good service.
Awesome place for friends and family meet ups. Great atmosphere and great service. All the bartenders are the bomb. Great food. Daily homemade soup specials are fantastic.

Love this place.  Great food, great bartenders, great service, great owners!  It is clean and the food is amazing.  They have healthy food choices and the owner - Nick and Sandy take great pride in this place.   The flat breads are awesome - good salads, great portions.  They have a great atmosphere for the gamer or non gamer.  Enjoy!  Cheers!

My husband and I stopped by here for a couple of drinks and some appetizers. We sat at a small table to the side of the bar in comfy chairs. The food was good, they have really interesting items to choose from that are tasty and not boring. They have an interactive jukebox with a lot of music! I loved that part the best.

Tried this place looking for something new. Everything was very delicious. All the prices were reasonable. Atmosphere was nice... dining room is nicer than your typical gaming bar. Service was a friendly and attentive. I'm definitely impressed.

No thank you
This is the most insanely boring bar in all of Summerlin 
I'm surprised it's still opened. 
It's never busy when I'm
In there. 
I've been there 3 times and every time at any given hour it's just lame

I don't know exactly what martinis they sling that you can't get anywhere else. 

Just my
Opinion

Anytime friends say "let's meet at The Martini" we usually end up changing meeting places or staying for one drink then leaving

We dined here with husbands business colleagues last night and had the absolute worst service I've experienced in a long time. He had been here twice before while they were in Vegas in business and had a good experience. The food was excellent but the service was despicable. Our waiter started out good but then a table of about 8 young single women arrived and we lost his attention on numerous occasions. When one of the wives at our table jokingly told him he was guaranteed the better tip at our table he explained these were personal friends of his that we're moving out of state. So basically justifying his neglect to our table. We were the only two tables seated in the entire place. After and hour and a half and our meals still hadn't arrived I asked the bar to send the manager over. Finally and hour and forty-five minutes later we had our food and still no manager. Once our table was cleared and the waiter brought our check he assured us the manager would be by shortly but that she was in the kitchen cooking. We finally paid the bill and left, never having spoke with the manager. I'm typically pretty understanding of a venue being short staffed but for the manager to not feel any sense of urgency to at least come apologize is unacceptable. We won't be back.

Love the martini! We went there on super bowl Sunday in the morning for some martinis (yes I know that we were drinking very early). This is Vegas!! The martinis tasted great and were a decent price. The bartender was super nice and although she was the only one working and had a few people at the bar she made sure we were taken care of. 

We also ordered food, I got the breakfast burrito and it was amazing! Exactly what I needed to recover from the night before. 

10/10 would recommend

Nice upscale local bar with a good specialty cocktail menu. They also have a nice wine cellar on display. The food is really good here, definitely a step up from standard bar food. The spinach dip is excellent (the chips are fresh) and the tomato bisque soup with grilled cheese takes you back to childhood. They have gaming as well at the bar.
Came for lunch, had the pesto chicken sandwich and side salad. The lettuce was bad and the chicken was so overly salted that I feel like I ate a salt rock... Disappointed to say the least

So we went here on a Groupon, and what a Groupon it was!!! It was I believe $49 for one app, two salads, two entrees, a dessert, and two drinks. HOLY SMOKES THAT'S A LOT!! But I mean hey, it's off the Strip by about 10 minutes in Summerlin, which is a nice suburb of Vegas, I know because my parents used to buy and sell condo's there before the great bust sometime ago now. So anyway...the place is nice inside. Its kinda off in a corner of a parking lot, and at first you're kind of like mmmm I'm not so sure about this place, but then you open the doors and it's all good. It was a very slow night since it was Monday night, I really didn't mind that at all since of course you're always battling the crowds on the Strip. 
So we sat down, the fireplace wasn't lit so we asked the server to light it, which she did and so began our culinary adventure. HAHA OK well it wasn't anything that fancy but it was nice. The chicken wings we got were tasty for the app, the salads were a little too dressing-ed out for my liking (next time I will be asking dressing on the side) but the drinks were super tasty! I ordered the burger, which was complicated as hell on paper but pretty darn tasty if you ask me (although I have had better but that doesn't matter it still was a good burger). My friend had the Fish n Chips and said he liked them, but by time our entrees had come out we were beyond stuffed! It was a little too much food but that's OK I'd rather have more food than not enough. We got our dessert to go, the Fluffer Nutter, which was OMG amazing at 3am which drunk! HAHA so yes all in all it was a great place and I would most definitely come back, but the Groupon sure helps a lot :)

This place is a secret gem!! My boyfriend and I tried them the first time via online delivery. We decided to try them in person a few days ago and it was nt retreated. First off, they have amazing mac&cheese balls. Do not miss those. I had a great salad with the tangerine dressing, it was awesome. My bf loved the spaghetti. The martinis were worth going back for. They offer low-cal options for drinks. 

The best part? The fluffier nutter! It was absolutely awesome! :)

I had one of the best burgers of my life here... Or maybe just the wine reduction sauce that went on top... Or maybe after the couple drinks I had before the burger... Either way, it was good. And the Mac and cheese was pretty good too!! Downside - prices not all that great. Then again, I'm a poor college student at heart. Definitely worth trying!! And the staff has always been friendly when I've gone.

I wanted to love this place it's by my house and the presentation of the food and drinks is beautiful. Taste??? Um I REALLY love the deep fried zucchini, I've been their 3 times! That's sad. I went with friends but we nibbled on eachother' food! I had a creamy chicken garlic pasta that literally had a pile of pasta, 2 pieces of asparagus and had to ask for a side of pesto to add flavor I ate the chicken took the pasta home. I couldn't eat it! It had aerated to better and cream overnight in the fridge. Same thing withe the artichoke dip. I'm assuming it's the same base.

Two times I've ordered a Kobe burger medium rare to go. Both times it was so wrong! The first time it was just meat and bun?????

Second time it was 2 beef patties that weren't Kobe and add insult to injury not even a trace of pink, they cooked my angus Patti burgers to the texture of hokey pucks! My dog absolutely loved dinner that night!

Loved their fried Oreo dessert! My friend ordered that, and I had a piece. Probably one of the best desserts I've had in my life. They kind of reminded me of beignets too. I ordered the tiramisu dessert which was delish. We enjoyed their flatbread with mozzarella, tomato, and artichoke. It was good and on the healthy side and had the Bliss martinis. Our waitress was GREAT too! Always checked on us and gave us her recommendations.

I hate leaving this medium review but the service was just that awful. It was a sat night and they had special guest Michael Grimm performing. The place was packed but we managed to find 3 seats at the bar.  The female bartender was awesome and on top of our service from being greeted to moving us across the bar where more space had become available. We had our 1st round of drinks and food service through her and everything was great. As her shift ended and graveyard had started, and that's where it went down. Michael Grimm had finished, guests were leaving and our female bartender had clocked out. It was us, about half the bar seated and 2 male bartenders. Even the owners had left. 

We had finished dinner and their happy hour had kicked in.  We studied the menu for our choices and we're ready to order..and waited...waited...and waited. We were on the corner of the bar and a bartender was talking to the couple 2 stools up from us. I had to get out of my chair, walk up to him an politely apologize for the interruption but ask for service. He immediately came over and apologized for his behavior and said he was completely rude but he was showing pics on his cell phone of a coworker in a accident who had survived. He kindly comped that round of drinks and the peace was made.

That round of drinks had finished...and waited...waited...and waited. Again completely ignored by him again and the other bartender. It was so bad that the sober male with us was slamming his hand against the bar for service to cash out. We paid, left 10% tip and I feel obligated to leave this long negative review. 

Martinis is a higher standard gaming bar. When you walk in, you know your paying more $$$ then the bar next door. The food is awesome (not typical bar food) drinks are great (pricey if not gambling) and wine list is fantastic. We were ignored and the bartenders lacked in showing equal service to all the guest, they had their regulars who received more attention. This bar and location, you would expect more. There are plenty of other choices for dinner, drinks and gaming to choose from and with competition high, the service should be higher.
Sat at the bar, had great service. Ordered sliders, which were great, and calamari, which were ok. Overall, I would definitely come back.

Martini's was closed for a long time.  Not sure if it was because of the recession or some internal issue.  But it had been reopened for at least a month when I checked it out after a late night out.  Was told it is under new management.

I only ate there once before the closing and was not impressed.  I ate there last night and loved it.  Whatever the new owners have done is working (except my Arnold Palmer which was way too sweet.  They must have terrible lemonade).

1) Martini Sliders - some of the best sliders I've ever had.  High quality bun, a little blue cheese and caramelized onion, and thousand island dressing on the plate so you can put as much as you desire.  Meat was juicy with a nice seared crust on it.  Had that little bit of crispiness I like on a burger.  They seared it like a steak which is how it should be done.  Really just great.
2) Chicken wings - served nice and crispy with either ranch or blue cheese dressing.  I got it mild so it was a bit bland.  Next time I'll get it hot.  But it was really well cooked.  Chicken was moist inside and the outside was nice and crispy.  

They have the standard happy house menu late at night.  Great prices, great quality, great location, great atmosphere, and great service.

Well done Martini.

This was the third time we have been to The Martini and each time has been a journey of great food, good martinis and super service. Most happy hour menus have you settling for one or two items. With their menu the decision is easy. Pick anything and it's great. When you find a place like The Martini you know you have found your Happy Hour

I was shocked with The New menu... Second time I'm here since yesterday because I don't cook ! Wake up hungry and thank god I live in las vegas Beverlyhills , the drinks taste like vodka  not like water without asking, nice music as well

I've only been to The Martini a handful of times but I absolutely adore this bar! 
-the food is simply incredible, it is almost gourmet and the prices are definitely reasonable! My go to is the grilled cheese with tomato soup or any of their burgers!
-the drinks are phenomenal and they even have a low calorie section! My favorite is the xxx drink! 
-their best burger is the drunken burger on a pretzel bun and their chicken Alfredo is also super amazing!
-the service is always wonderful and I have never had a bad experience :) everyone is friendly and very attentive!
-they have great happy hour drinks and food

The martini is a nice bar that specializes in Martinis but seem to have a well rounded selection of wines as well as a full bar. 

I came for the late night midnight happy hour. We were out drinking so I didnt get to try any of the signature Martinis this time. 

Foodwise -

I got zucchini fries - it was standard but pretty good. I have a soft spot for spears vs chips of zucchini. It came with two sauces - ranch and a aioli. 

Sloppy Joe sliders - came with 3. These were actually really good!  Nothing at all like cafeteria mystery meat and full of flavor.  

Mac and cheese truffle balls- came with 3. It was just OK. The balls were crunchy and had truffle flavor but the tomato sauce was tangy and kinda cut the truffle. It was better when I didnt eat it with the sauce. 

Service was decent enough. We got our food rather fast and were checked on. 


Overall decent happy hour. Its nice inside and laid back so it would be a decent option for a date or a night out.
Re'c the Travelzoo promotion and visited on vacation in April 2012. Food was great and so was the martini. Will go back on next trip!

Great service & ambience! The bartenders are super friendly & always make great recommendations. I love their happy hour menu. The truffle Mac n cheese bites & the deep fried Oreos are a must!! Oh! & their martini's are not bad either ; )

Great food but they have the most clueless bartender/server (female with long dark hair and a niners ball cap). Went in on a Sunday for football and something to eat. She seems more interested in checking her cell than providing customer service. Ordered my meal and she did not bother to ask what I wanted with my steak. Then had to ask her when the meal was coming after waiting a while. Zero communication. Not sure why the owner has this person because the rest of their staff is awesome.

This is a nice little neighborhood bar - I like the different seating areas. Although, the bartenders weren't terribly attentive and were hard to make eye contact with, even though the place wasn't busy at all. We didn't try the food but will next time!

If i could give this bar zero stars i would. Can't believe the experience i had. The bartender was rude and was too busy watching the rebel game to get me a drink when i first got there. Then after one drink she told me i was being too loud and threatened to kick me  out. I love the bartender Amy she is sweetheart but this new girl is no good. Get rid of her and i might come back. I loved this place before this and now i never want to go back. FIRE HER. what would've been a $50+ tab turned into one drink because i couldn't believe the service i received.

Officially my favorite football spot! Keep in mind that I don't want it rowdy, and I am not a die-hard fan of any one team, but the past couple of weekends, we have wanted to catch some games on a Saturday or Sunday evening. They have happy hour every day (conveniently), and their HH red wine isn't just one option! They actually have a Pinot Noir, $5 during happy hour, and I think it is delicious! Happy Hour snacks include $5 wings, and they don't skimp on the serving. As I mentioned in my first review, the atmosphere is leagues above your average video poker spot; it feels like the ultimate man cave. It isn't too smoky, and the bartenders are always happy to get the TVs tuned in to the game we want to watch. We take the corner seat so we can see two games, and we're good to go for several hours and several glasses of wine. Albert and Nick are A+ bartenders. It's really the next best thing to sitting in my living room.
The Blueberry martini was delicious. The food was very good. The service, excellent. Our waitress was very attentive, cheerful, and just did a great job overall.
Everytime we come here , we have a amazing time. One of the best upscale bars in the area. Food is amazing and drinks are perfect every time.

Went for a late dinner. Food was delicious, nice atmosphere, service was good overall. Didn't like that late at night they make you sit in the bar area though and you have to ask for a regular dinner menu.

Still our favorite Friday night spot, still the best food but have to update adding Malaini (sp) as also one of the best bartenders ever. Love her!  She is sweet, remembers what we drink and is very attentive and friendly. This place is awesome and I hope nothing ever changes.
We liked coming here everyone was very welcoming, calm professional atmosphere elegant classy and strong drinks worth the price. Best off place strip to come in my opinion

Every time I dine here it is always a good experience. Although the last time I was there they burnt my steak completely to hockey puck status, they made up for it with the other food they offer. The Truffle Mac n cheese balls are to die for! It's a must have for sure.

Scale 1 = awful to 10 = incredible 

Atmosphere = 8
Food = 7
Drinks = 4
Service = 1

The Mrs. and I love going out and finding new places to eat. Read good reviews about his place so we gave it a try.  

Atmosphere - When you first walk in, the look and feel are on point. It's upscale without being over the top. You can show up dressed or casual and feel comfortable. 

Food - variety of good bar food that is done up.  Normal items but with added chef like flair. 

Drinks - I order an old fashion and the fruit wasn't muddled.  You can call that fussy but it's part of the recipe which makes the flavor.  My wife ordered a Manhattan which was not made correctly. We did enjoy the Diesel which was cool.  I point this out cause they talk about their mixologist's on the web page.  They need more schooling for sure.  

Service - this can make or break an evening.  The bar was not slammed and the service was sooooo slow.  We were at a side table with a server and my wife got so tired of waiting she went to the bar to get a drink. The bartender was super slow to acknowledge her and then reluctant to make her the drink cause she was at a table.  Like gave her a hard time about it.  We paid for the drink at the bar just so she would make it.

We casually stopped by this place on a random night last week, and like to call it our new find.  The friendly bartender made killer drinks and had great insight regarding the unique menu.  Although we are headed there to dine next week, I can already sense that this place will be worth every penny we spend there.
So happy I found this place!  Hats off to the chef and thanks Bruce for that awesome hospitality!

I love this place. The atmosphere is great, as well as the customer service for the most part. My favorite bartender there is Bruce..love that guy! Some of the female bars there can be a little standoffish, especially Amy. Everyone else is cool.For bar food, the food is very good, with the exception of chicken wings. I think they could do better. There are a lot of drinks to select from, which is a plus. The main reason I find myself going back to this bar is the fact that it's nonsmoking. I love that feature about it because quite frankly, I don't believe I should have to sit in a room filled with smoke when I'm not a smoker myself. So far my favorite local bar in Las Vegas.

Came here for the 1st time last night. Plenty of seating near the bar and also on the side. The bartenders were all friendly and attentive. One of my favorite things about the bar was that it wasn't smokey like some other places I know and the music choice was chill. 

I'm a martini noob so I didn't really know what to order. I ended up getting the Green Tea "low-cal" martini drink. Overall, it was strong and had the perfect amount of sweetness. 

For food, we ordered the mild chicken wings (delicious; how can you mess up chicken wings?), truffled mac n cheese balls (perfectly crispy, cheesy and it didn't taste greasy like other ones I've tasted), prosciutto flat bread (plain; nothing special) and the drunken kobe burger (a tad bit too much blue cheese if you ask me). Overall,  portions were decent, food came out promptly and well presented.

When I come back, I will def order the mac n cheese balls and chicken wings again. After checking in on Yelp and receiving 15% off our bill, I felt it was worth it. Next time, I'll have to try that filet mignon special they have!

Our arms were twisted after a Yelp event to meet up for some drinks. 
I wasn't hungry so I just got a Mint Chocolate Girl Scout Cookie Martini that was incredible! My husband ended up ordering a Drunken Kobe Burger with a side of House Fries. He loved the burger. I wasn't into it, but the Cabernet Demi that they put on the side for dipping was addictive. It was more like a gravy, dip your fries in it, that's all you need to know. Do It!
Our waiter was excellent. Prices are good for the quality.
I will definitely go back for more.

I come to The Martini a lot and I am never disappointed.  Never.

The drinks are on point, and of extremely high quality.  The bartenders are awesome, they seem to be able to read their customers very well.  Sometimes I go in to just hang out to be one with my thoughts and they let me be, but if I'm in a talkative mood they read my mood and are there to shoot the breeze.   

The martini's here are the best that I've ever had.  My personal favorite is named the Vespar; made with Boodles Gin, Grey Goose, and Lillet Blanc.  They also make a S'mores martini that's insanely delicious, if you have a sweet tooth.  The Martini serves quality drinks that take craftsmanship, not like the junk at Blue Martini that just get the job done, which I'm not hating on because sometimes you just need a drink that gets the job done. 

The food here is unreal.  I've tried pretty much everything on the menu.  My favorite is the Chicken Scaloppini which is served with seasonal vegetables and risotto that's unbelievably good.  I also recommend the Fish & Chips which is more than just fish and fries.  It comes with beer battered zucchini and shrimp as well.  I don't recall the prices of these dishes, but they're very reasonably priced and comes with a lot of food.  

The quality of food for the price is second to none.  The drinks are great and also reasonably priced.  The atmosphere is way better than any other neighborhood gaming bar that I've been to .  Also, everything on the food menu is served 24 hours a day.

One of my friends gave us a nice two-person meal voucher for this place, and it was a wonderful experience.

It was a full meal with wine included, and I went on this full Kobe beef kick for my meal selection.  Wat that meant was Kobe beef sliders (so ridiculously good), and spaghetti with Kobe meatballs.  Everything was excellent, and between the Kobe taste explosion, and the accompanying salad, I was very much in a "comfortable" place.  The Pinot Noir that went with the meal only added to that particular zone.

I might have passed on dessert, but it was included in the package, and let me tell you: I'm glad I didn't pass.  I tried the "Nutter Fluffer": This peanut butter concoction with a batter fried shell, and marshmallow and chocolate dipping sauces.

Wow.

Talk about amazing.  It was ridiculously good, and I still periodically think about this dessert, which is unusual for me.  But if you eat here, this is the dessert choice to get.

Service was excellent.  Always there to make suggestions, check on the meal and anything that was needed, yet was totally unobtrusive.  This was coupled with this wonderful, intimate dining atmosphere that was just the perfect setting for a "date night".  The place just had a really cool vibe to it, which made for an excellent evening out.

I can see myself going back again, and hopefully soon.  I left feeling pleased (and very full) from the experience, and it's one that I will look forward to recreating. 

Definitely worth a visit, if anything, for that amazing dessert.

Happy hour is the way to go. We were able to sit at a table in the main dining room. No smoking. $5 drinks and $5 appetizers. The food is way better than bar food. We ordered wings and zucchini sticks. The flatbread pizzas are the flattest I have ever seen.
Albert is fu#% amazing! Besides his exquisite bar tending skills, we enjoy visiting The Martini few times a month. Delicious food and over all great atmosphere. Cheers!

Initially, I wanted to give this restaurant 2 or 3 stars because we waited for the hostess way too long to be seated. There should be a someone up front all the time but I guess it's a little harder when the restaurant is open 24/7.

However, she finally came so it was fine after that. 

I bought the Travelzoo deal. This was a four course meal with a choice of white or red wine.

I had ahi tuna chips, ceasar salad, rosemary salmon, and fried oreos with ice cream. 

Service was on point and food was delicious. Location is nice, it's near boca park in Summerlin.

First time here and Bruce was phenomenal the whole night. Me and some friends came in late night to gamble and eat. Flat breads are A1 and their white pizza. I will definitely be coming back and it might be my new bar. Shout out to Bruce !

Moved here after the original martini's closed and almost didn't try this place because of the confusing web links to old websites.  Luckily we found out they reopened and gave it a try.  Atmosphere - 4 out of 5.  The lounge looks awesome with comfy seats for small groups.  The martinis are great and we wanted to steal the Martini art but it wouldn't fit under our shirts.  The appetizers are very interesting and the Kobe sliders are very good.  Tried the truffle mac and cheese balls but they lacked flavor.  The rest of the food was great. So much more I want to try.  The martini's were also wonderful.  Definitely worth a try.  And although you can spend a lot here, the price is not unreasonable for the food you get and the markup on the wine is not so high as some places. The service was excellent, from the bartender who answered the phone and was very nice to our waiter who was very helpful.

I love, love, love the martini! They have the best happy hour, food, and service. Some of my favorite dishes are the ahi tuna chips, kobe sloppy Joe sliders (yumm!!), trail mix salad w/ ahi tuna (candied pecans, apricots, spring mix, and bleu cheese went very well together), and the must try calamari. Did I mention the sliders and calamari is part of their happy hour menu? Along with a great selection of drinks, $15 FILET mignon after midnight, and even more delicious menu items available 24 hrs. 
They have a great ambiance, that caters to a more upscale crowd. Which I find as a huge plus, especially while gaming there. You can play your keno, or poker in peace while enjoying great food and drinks without worrying about the same obnoxiously annoying people you see at most other gaming bars. 
My favorite bartenders are Amy, Albert, and Carlos! They know how to make great drinks, that are not too sweet which is why I consider them to be the perfect liquid chefs. If you dine on the restaurant side, Dennis is the best server! He is attentive, knowledgeable about the menu, and very good at anticipating needs in advance. An all around sweet heart!
Thanks for the great service and food Martini!! I will be back soon!
I really enjoyed this place. The selections of Martini's are endless and the service was pretty good. We ordered the spinach artichoke dip and it was great. I would definitely go back.

This is a favorite locals spot with great service. The desserts are incredible and worth the trip by itself. It has a good vibe with huge comfortable chairs, tons of TV's for the game, and very good bartenders.  This is our favorite spot off the strip.

So it is official. I really do enjoy this place. I have been here twice so far for happy hour. 
Service: both times I have been here both servers have been great. I believe my first time the servers name was Keith. I can be mistaken though. He was very nice and helpful. He went over the happy hour menu with me. And when my boyfriend came in he was sure to greet him also. We got there at 530 and happy hour was over at 6. Before the server closed our tab at 605 he made sure we didn't want anything else off that menu.
The second time we went it was Saturday night. I was expecting a very loud crowd but I guess we just missed them. This time we were served by heather. She's very nice and willing to talk with us like we are friends of hers. Which I loved. They had a dj because of a birthday party and also the owners birthday... Btw happy birthday to you nick. 
Now let's get to the drinks. 
I had a appletini. 3/4 were great. 1 tasted more like water. All depends on who's making it I guess though. 
My boyfriend had a beer this last time and he said it was very good and they know how to serve a beer since they frost their glasses. The only down fall was they don't have blue moon or shock top beer on draft. If they did this place would be a 5 all the way. 
The food: it was good. Normal bar food. Wish the wings were alittle more meatier but the taste is good. I'm happy they don't overdo the sauce on them. 
Over all I love this place and I will be back.
Very classy, I had the chopped salad my co-worker had the Tomato Basil soup with grilled cheese.  Presentation was perfect, staff was friendly, and food came out quick.

I came here after work to have a drink with my co-workers, not exactly for any happy hour specials but just because it was close to work.  This actually turned out to be a good option because Guinness was here having some type of Guinness Blonde launching thing.  Plusses:  Free Guinness Blonde, and hot looking Guinness Blondes.  Minuses:  Guinness employees who were entirely too loud right next to us.  But one of them gave us free beer so all is forgiven.

Our server was very nice and very patient with our group, who weren't exactly the model of efficiency when it came to ordering.  Thank you, server girl, for your kindness.  I like the dark-ish but modern dcor, which does justice to the fancy exterior of the building.  There is a long bar to the right of entrance, along with tables and comfort seats along the left side.  To the left of that is a separate room of additional seating.  

Their happy hour deal is really good, with all their drafts being $3 and select appetizers for $6 (I think?).  We only had a couple of orders of taquitos, but it was very good.  I'd like to try some of their other menu next time, as well as their namesake, martinis, which I didn't try this time around.  One of my co-worker did have one and liked it.

It's overall a solid 4-star experience, and possibly more upon me sitting down for some variety in their offerings.

Table-for-1 Factor:  I think their bar is a pretty good spot for having a drink on your own.  Upscale without being pretentious, and looking appropriate for grabbing a drink and people watching.
Great!! Love this place bartender was extremely nice!! They also have USB chargers for your cell phone at every gambling play booth !!  Very smart !!
Came here late night with my husband after he got off work. This is a nice location. I love the lounge areas and am glad they're open 24/7. They're food is great and their drinks are amazing !

This place has changed so much.  Staff seemed to only wait on certain people- We literally sat there for 20 minutes before someone even acknowledged or asked if we'd like to have a drink. More than likely will not return

Next up for Restaurant Week was The Martini.  My junior-sized Shrimp Cocktail still appeared to be defrosting but was still tasty with a very good Horseradish-based Sauce.  Tomato Bisque Soup with Creme Fraiche and basil was zesty.  A Side Caesar Salad with Mozzarella shavings on top was also very good.  

Grilled Rosemary Lemon Salmon with Risotto that tasted like vanilla, and al dente grilled Zucchini, featured a great moist hunk of salmon.  A gooey Fried Oreo Sundae proved to be an excellent, novel dessert.

The atmosphere was comfortable in a large dining room walled off from the bar, with soft jazz piped in overhead.  Service was very good except I had to ask twice for Sweet & Low for my Iced Tea.  I expect to continue to frequent this fine establishment--not for libations for for beautifully prepared comfort food.

Have always drove by here saying I was going to stop in soon. So spur of the moment my gf and I came in to check it out. Very nice clean bar area a bit on the upscale side was worried I was under dressed ( shorts , tshirt , flip flops ) but was still treated great. Happy hour is great $5 select Martinis $6 and $7 appetizers I believe. Can't comment on the food yet but Apple Martinis were very good for the price and service was welcoming and friendly will be coming back in the future.

I am a fan and will come back to enjoy their fantastic happy hour from 3-6 again!

They make an Amazing pink cosmopolitan martini, I was really enjoying them throughout the evening.

This place is dark and cozy with a touch of class! The service is great with friendly staff who really complete your experience.

This is a great spot to meet up for a drink and just unwind from a long day of work or sex. 

I only wish I had been a visitor sooner as this is a nice spot that I have passed a kazillion times however never stopped in.

I will be back for happy hour for sure, with $5 Amazing strong cocktails how can you go wrong! Don't forget to try the pink cosmopolitan, you won't regret it I promise!

This place is awesome!! We got the chicken and the steak, both were perfectly cooked and amazing.  I'm a bit of a wine snob and I thought their wine selection, although modest, was very high quality and reasonably priced.  We will be back!!  Also ask for Ray, he was a fantastic server!
Visited here after a Yelp event.  Drinks where good, food was good but because of the location and where I live I don't think I'll be back.

I just went to the martin bar off the strip across the street from boca park and I had the best espresso martin I've ever had in my life. The drinks and food are good but the service is what's going to make me come back. If you want quality service at a off the strip prices come to The Martin and ask for mailani she is top tear. So if your looking for a good night out this is the place to be.

Hey I"m new to the Yelp world but thought this Las Vegas original was worthy of sharing.  I was pleaently surprised when my husband and I went for dinner The Martini and saw a wonderful artisian cheese platter on the menu.  Paired with a great bottel of wine and it soon became on of our favorite spots! Occasionally we'll even bring our children with us to happy hour where their friendly staff always brings the girls their favorite sliders.
